I will give kudos to the police dept for showing up in record time but this was very unnerving for us. The place was clean enough and we really didn't have too many noise complaints so if you're just looking for a place to lay your head that's not near much at all, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you smoke or have a dog this place is great”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: So for the money this hotel is a nice value. It is in a very odd location off a busy street around industrial buildings. You have to take two U turns just to get into the hotel. First night we stayed in the older building (newer one was sold out) and it was a very small room and the noise from the road was very loud. I would have to say it was even a little scary being so isolated from the main hotel. They next night we moved to the newer building (with a $25 increase in price) and it was much nicer. The Smoking and dog friendly hotels in San Deigo are limited and for that I would have to consider this a good choice (My Dad smokes and he was also staying in this hotel) Breakfast was just OK, nothing fancy. They do keep the rooms very clean. The grounds and gardens are in good condition and very pretty. But if I was traveling without a Dog and without a smoker I would stay in one of the large resort style hotels and pay the small differnece in pricing

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Fifer_8
Reviews.Content: As has been already reported, this hotel is not in the most salubrious part of town. However it is within walking distance of the Old Town itself and if a dash of history is your thing you'll find it interesting. Also you can pick up a Trolley tour which will give you a two hour trip round the city. We found this very interesting and good value, especially as you can get on and off during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean local Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Momof4Graham_WA
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego from Palm Springs to go to Sea World and Legoland. We stayed one night. The desk clerk was very helpful and told us how to get to a resturant for dinner. Cafe Coyote it was a yummy mexican resturant. The hotel was nice and clean. It had a very nice breakfast. Everyone staying at the hotel was nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: coachrich
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Old Town Inn for 13 nights in March. Trip Adviser was right on. Room was ready at check in. Desk service was exceptional. Good continental breakfast. Close attention to details. Location was super- easy to get to all attractions- make use of Pacific Highway to get to Downtown, pier, Midway, Balboa and many others. Use their directions that are given to you. Many restaurants of all types are within 5 minutes drive or you can walk . Maid service was excellent . Pool was heated but air temp was cool during our stay. Didn't hear a bad word from anyone while there. Recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are correct!”
Reviews.Author: lkestotravel
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay. Nice and clean rooms, friendly staff. We didn't think the area was bad at all, felt it was safe and it is only a block from Old Town. It is also just minutes from the zoo and Sea World. We would totally stay again! This is indeed a great motel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: When I first made reservations for the hotel, I wasn't sure if I was going to get a bad one for the price I paid. For my surprise the hotel turned to be one of the best ones in old town. Great customer service and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star with a plus 10 in Accomodating,Friendly,Clean,HonestyPlus!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoisCaron
Reviews.Content: 14 of us checked in at one time and were met wwwith exceptional hoapitality. Our rooms were reserved, clean, and ready. We were all into our rooms in no time. We were centrally located and given specific instructions on where to eat, attractions, how to get there, and even made reservations for us to eat. I would highly recommend this to even people who are used to high class traveling. Best place in San Deigo! No one in our group had any complaints. I left a pair of shoes in the room and they were returned to me. In any other place I would not have gotten them back. This is a definte plus. Thank you to the staff for making our stay wonderful. We also had an excellent continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property- Inconsiderate Guests”
Reviews.Author: pistnbroke
Reviews.Content: Having prevoiously arranged to store our luggage prior to check in we were pleased that when we arrived about noon to have our two rooms available , We were pleased with the motel overall despite the cold "heated" pool. The only down side, which is not the inn's fault, was that guets would start their noisy vehicles and leave them running as they loaded their luggage and shouted to one and other from the outside corridor. One loud truck & occupants left at 3.30am!!! I will never rent a hotel with outside corrodors again for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept, great service, very clean and very accessible to Trolley!”
Reviews.Author: OhMai
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this Inn! I'm from Vancouver, Canada, and haven't been to many places down in the States... Luckily TripAdvisor made things a lot easier. I had to choose between this Inn and Comfort Inn which is also situated in the Old Town area. Thank goodness we chose this one. Why? We took the trolley, while our other colleagues that chose Comfort Inn had to take the bus and ended up being late for the Convention every time! We stayed here for the ACN National Convention from February 27 to March 2nd. Every staff working at the Inn was friendly. When I was calling in to check for availability three separate times, each staff member I had talked with was very polite and respectful. We arrived in San Diego early and the staff were able to keep our luggage in the Manager's office until we came back for a proper check-in. The room was basic but very clean. The two queen beds were very comfortable and the shower was great! Every day coming back from the Convention we would find our beds beautifully re-made. The concierge is open 24 hours. One night, two of my colleagues were thirsty and wanted some milk to drink at midnight... The staff in charge allowed us to get some milk from the kitchen. Breakfast was plentiful with bagels, waffle ovens, 3 or 4 types of cereal, orange juice, milk, muffins and danish buns. Commuting to the Convention Center was made relatively easy by the Trolley Line. Warning: It can get confusing at the Old Town stop! If you want to go to the Convention Center, take the Blue line (although it comes to you at the wrong direction... It's just that it's the end of the blue line, and so the trolley actually goes in reverse.), stop at America Plaza, walk across the trolley line and then Take the Orange line to Convention Center. You'll get the hang of it :)! Total commute time from Old Town to Convention (approx 15-20 minutes). I'd recommend everyone to try the Casa Guadalajara Restaurant situated in Old Town, and the Thai Ly restaurant in the heart of Gaslamp Quarters. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, continental breakfast, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rrortiz67
Reviews.Content: I loved this place, the staff was nice, accomodating. The room was clean, beds were comfortable, pillows were comfortable. It was really close to Old Town like 3-4 blocks. Was in an industrial part of the town but barely. It was really nice, and the price was right. We got waffles, danishes, bagels, cereal, coffee, muffins, all for breakfast. It was nice and well staffed, and tasted great. It was cute, decorated nicely. The pool was heated, but no hot tub, but that is ok. Had free internet connection and computer in the lobby. Very nice inexpensive and would definetly stay there again. And Free parking too.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly Sliding into Irrelevency? Change the name to Old Inn?”
Reviews.Author: jasonblu
Reviews.Content: Being a fairly seasoned, and previously pleased "Old Town Inn" veteran, I booked a two night stay at my "Old Faithful" San Diego hotel, somewhat excited to show my wife and new baby that there are still great hotels that don't cost a lot. Long story short, we checked out early and stayed at the Dolphin Motel (see my review of them elsewhere). Something seems to have happened to this once wonderful gem of a hotel, or maybe I was looking at it now from a different angle, having my wife and baby there with me. I am not sure which. Notables on SHUTTLE SERVICE Easy. There is none. Take a cab - its about 15 bucks from the airport. Notables on CHECK IN We called to have a room reserved that day, and, I guess due to the bad economy, there was no problem finding vacancy. I talked to a very nice gentleman who took down my name and said there would be room waiting for us. When we got there (at midnight, mind you), there was a new clerk, and she had no idea we were coming. Now, to her credit - she said their system was doing backups, so she could not access the database. I guess they don't have a backup means to pass down from shift to shift on who is expected to arrive during their system down times. Something they should consider doing. We were told we had to wait till the system came back up. 10 - 15 minutes went by, then my wife and baby came in wondering what was the hold up. The baby started crying. Next thing I know, the clerk is flipping through the paper register finding us a vacant room. Why it took a crying baby to think up this backup method, I am not sure. Maybe for 75 bucks a night, they don't want to go TO Crazy on providing good service. I say this tongue in cheek, as the girl behind the desk clearly didn't want to be there, and was a obviously annoyed at her job. She was certainly not the cheerful lad who answered the phone 2 hours earlier. I'd have to say employee wise, they are hit and miss now. Before, I could never find an employee there that wasn't eager to help and cheerful. Notables on THE ROOM Immediately when I walked in the room, I sensed something was different. Where once there were immaculate, clean, neutral smelling rooms, I was hit with a wall of sour, musty, almost urinal smell. I sniff tested the carpet and the bedding. Though they didnt smell all that fresh, that wasn't it. It was the A/C unit. Apparently they have this policy to save electricity where they shut off the units when the residents aren't in the room. I am guessing this is what is causing mold to grow in the units? It was so bad, we had to just shut off the unit. Thankfully, it was 67 degrees outside, so, it wasnt like we were sweating in the room. The residual stink was enough to ruin the rest of the night though and we both awoke with headaches. Compounding the odor, the carpet had also been recently heavily doused with carpet powder - so the smell of the perfumes in the cleaner combined with the wet sour mold smell, made it nearly intolerable, odor wise. Note to management: stop crop dusting the old worn ditry carpets with carpet powder and just replace the dang things. They are old, dingy and creepy feeling on bare feet... DEFINITELY due for replacement. The bedding is the typical, cheapo, plastic, rough, cheezy floral print bedcovers that are not fit to use as blankets. Those always annoy me. Two words to hotel-bedding-success guys: Cot, ton. Everything else is your typical budget hotel room fare. BTW - No refer. No Microwave. No iron. Actually - its a bed, a shower, a sink, a toilet, a moldy A/C unit and not much more. Zero Frills. Wife wants me to mention though that they had "nice new granite-ish counter tops." Cool Beans. Needless to say, I was no longer talking up the place to the wife. She was not impressed. Notables on their WIFI INTERNET. Summary: It's a cruel Joke. Fellah's, dont be fooled by their listing of offering high speed internet in the rooms. Its a sham. They limit the ENTIRE hotel area to 2 Mb/s (for comparison, a typical single home internet cable service provides 11Mb/s.) !! They even have this retarded system that will document your MAC address and ban you from the router for downloading "large files" , but don't define what that constitutes a "large file". "Pretty much only enough to check your email, is it. " said the clerk. I had an important "large file" (132 Mb) I needed to DL for business the next day and I was locked out in minutes, or so I thought. Upon further inspection, I realized that my wife's laptop and both our iphones had signal but couldnt log on. A router issue. Nothing to do with my "large file". I called the number for tech support listed by the room phone, and the silly lady on the other end didn't know her routers from ravioli. Seriously. Like a robot, she started walking me through this check-list of stuff completely unrelated to the issue at hand, laboring over what operating system I was using, blah blah, when, since 3 systems all using different OS's had no signal - The antenna's clearly just needed to be reset. I tried to cut to the chase with her, but she mentally short circuited when I suggested we just have the routers reset. Wasting time there, I had to just hung up. I called the front desk, told them the situation. They said they could reset the antenna's. Only, they never did. Or if they did, the internet never did come back up. That was a big one for me. In this day and age, one HAS to have connectivity. Managers, get with the times! Get fast wifi, make it part of the room fee, and let it fly. Its cheap and easy. Notables on the CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST It's no La Quinta, let me tell you. They DO have the waffle maker (which, now, you have to mix your own mix. They now give you the cups, the water and the powdered mix and a plastic fork to mix it with. Before, they had them all ready made out, you just sprayed the iron, poured the pre-made mix, and voila - delicious waffles) other than the waffles, they have bagles, dry cereal, instant oatmeal, milk, coffee, and watery orange juice. That's about it. I seem to remember much more selection, and even scrambled eggs and bacon and sausage when I was there last. Maybe not. In a word - thin. Miscellany For those who are patriotic - I noted a strange anomaly. They have a California Flag, a Marine Corps Flag and the Mexican Flag hanging in a row from the roof...but NO AMERICAN FLAG. (at least not there - if there is one somewhere, I didn't see it) Odd. If your going to fly flags, and your IN America, fly an American Flag. Bizarre. Are they trying to make some political statement or something by omitting the Ole Stars and Stripes? HIGH POINTS. The grounds were clean. There was enough parking. The bathroom and shower area were clean. Its conveniently located: 5 minutes drive from the Airport. 5 minute walk to Old Town. Its Cheap. They had a nice military Rate of $68 plus tax. Came to like 74 a night. Would I stay there again? Replace all the carpeting, nuke the A/C units of the sour mold, keep em on, switch to all cotton bedding, offer decent WiFi without those retarded restrictions (11Mb/s is about $60 a month FOR THE ENTIRE HOTEL guys, come on) and of course, show your loyalty to the country that lets you run a business on its soil and RAISE THE GRAND OLD FLAG - keep the $68 military rate and I would come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: vballgirl78
Reviews.Content: After reading TripAdvisor reviews I chose the Old Town Inn. Location is great. Central to everything. Staff was extremely helpful. The only thing I would take issue with was the "heated pool". Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: batchelle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married at Sunset Cliffs, and chose the Old Town Inn for it's price and location between the ceremony site and the restaurant we went to after. The rooms were good size and clean. On the night of our wedding, the staff decorated the bad with rose petals in the shape of hearts. They were very friendly and helpful with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, decent, hidden gem of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Matju
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Diego for a couple of days. We stayed at the Old Town Inn for its location and convenience of San Diego. Its a 5 minute walk from Old Town and the bus station which we used alot to go sightseing and for the Zoo. The staff was amazing, the rooms were clean and nice. We even had a nice arrival gift and the staff helped us getting around San Diego. Breakfast was a nice american breakfast with local and national newspaper . For supper since its a 5 minute walk from Old Town , we choose the Cafe Coyote and Phil's BBQ ( 10 minute drive from the hotel) It is not located in the nicest part of San Diego but its also located in the most convenient part of it. We would go back there anything.

Reviews.Title: “Looks ca n be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: ilderton
Reviews.Content: Booked this 3-night stay directly with the web site. Using print out's of Goggle maps we had some difficulty in finding this place. It's true that the neighbourhood is not the most endearing, but that said we had a very comfortable and pleasant stay. Our room had two queen beds and although not the biggest of our road trip, we could not fault it. Again, the 10 - 15 minute walk to the Old Town, using the train station underpass walkway was not the most salubrious, but at no time did we feel threatened and the Old Town itself was a fascinating place (by night or day). During our stay we visited both Sea World & Tijuana (cannot recommend the Tijuana trip) and got the day off to an excellent start with the best buffet continental breakfast of our week. An additional bonus was the free to use Internet enabled terminal in the lobby. Overall I would recommend the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about the location (middle of nowhere next to a psych hospit”
Reviews.Author: jhoppy01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the phone from Australia (took a while as staff member could not understand my accent which is not strong). Had no idea what part of SD to stay so we felt Old Town was middle of all. We were booked to stay economy section which we found (upon arrival) was in the separate section which we didnt feel safe in as it was isolated, not able to be seen by staff. It was also really really small. so we upgraded and for an extra $10/night, got a kitchenette room which was HUGE, A great way to save money on food costs. Rooms were very clean and cleaners were very nice & helpful Nice quiet nights sleep (dont get that in my own home!), comfy beds, fabulous hot showers with great pressure (very important to have hot water and pressure....be surprised how many places have one or the other or even neither!) Staff was nice, very helpful, let us check in early (nicest was a young guy, forget his name BUT it was unusual). Free internet in the lobby was very handy as not many places offer this service. Couldnt believe how hard it was to find access to the net (many hotels offered it BUT you had to pay $2/minute which is ridiculous) Free breakfast each morning was great, a real money & time saver. Mind you, if I never eat another bagel again, I will be happy!!! Nice array of bagels, fruit, juices, hot drinks, waffles, cereals, toast. Inn was right next door to a psychiatric hospital (must admit, they were very quiet), there was nothing around & its in the middle of an industrial area. Didnt feel too safe walking after dark, especially walking to Old Town where we saw many many fights occurring in the tunnel to get to the nice part of Old Town or to the transport. Glad we hired a car as then we didnt have to go through the tunnel anymore. All in all, a lovely resort, just a shame where it was

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor is right--look no further!”
Reviews.Author: mamapiper
Reviews.Content: My son, who is 13, did all of the planning for our trip. He read reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to book the Old Town Inn. Am I glad he did! The hotel staff is helpful without being intrusive. Anna, who welcomed us, was very interested in helping us find everything we needed in and around San Diego. She even remembered our son's birthday, which he had talked about with her at the time of our reservation. When my daughter got sick, she helped us find meds and was very solicitous of her health. The hotel is perfectly situated. Pass by the tangle of Hotel Circle--this one is quiet and safe, with easy access to everything--airport, interstate, downtown. There was nothing we could not access from this location. Walking to Old Town for dinner is a treat after sightseeing all day! Park your car and just stay here! The hotel is nice and clean, with a family feel. We stayed 5 days and had absolutely no complaints. The breakfast is great value for money, and is continually replenished. The staff usually cleaned our room while we were at breakfast--a nice surprise for us! Not only would I stay here again, I would recommend this to anyone planning a trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Expirience”
Reviews.Author: AppMtnr
Reviews.Content: I chose this San Diego hotel because it was the most affordable with the best tripadvisor review. Upon arrival I was greeted by Anna with "Happy Birthday!", which she remembered from our booking over a month prior. The room was pristine and the shower was like heaven. I was concerned by the beds lacking duvets but they were extremely comfortable. The room was tastefully furnished and got no noise from the highway. We booked a suite that had two double beds and a kitchenette. We only used the fridge and microwave, but the stove looked clean. on the third night of our stay, my sister was very sick due to Gringo's brunch cafe. The suite worked perfectly because she could have space to get better, and I could sleep peacfully behin french doors. The next day I told them she was sick and given some aleve. The last day of our stay we were greeted with "Is your sister better?" by our friend Anna behind the front desk. The hotel's location was supreme within easy walking distance to old town and only five minutes from the airport and downtown. This hotel is a unique and personal expirience and I am sad for it to be over. this hotel added alot to my trip to San Diego and I strongly recommend it to anyone traveling to San Diego for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Rherrington1
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay for a fun getaway. The staff was friendly and professional. The rooms were clean. The hotel was centrally located, just a short drive to the zoo, downtown San Diego, and Pacific Beach. Old Town was charming. And the prices were very reasonable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in a good value, and a pleasant vacation. PS - while you are in San Diego go to pacific beach and check out Kono's on the beach. Great breakfast burritos!

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: mariaSurreyBC
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay while in San Diego. My husband, myself and our 6yr old really enjoyed staying at the Old Town Inn.We were there during the Christmas break. I booked our room directly with the hotel and it was very simple and easy to do and didn't have to deal with third parties so this was very nice. We stayed 4 days. Everything inside and outside was very well maintained and fresh looking. The lobby was comfortable and welcoming and they had a huge fire going in the fireplace the whole time we were there. The breakfast room was very big, lots of light, with lots of tables that held vases of flowers so it was very cheery. Breakfast had lots of delicious food to choose from and the make your own waffles are quite a hit with everyone, expecially my 6 yr old. There were quite a mix of people, lots of families, older folks, lots of youger folks, tourists from other countries so it was quite nice. Inthe lobby they had a table set up so that you could help yourself to coffee, tea and stuff 24hrs. There was also a computer with internet access. Outside had free parking and there was always a place to park. The front desk were great. We arrived very early, before check-in time, and they held our bags for us until the room was ready so we were able to go out and enjoy ourselves and not have to cart our luggage with us in the car. They knew a lot about what to do and were very helpful with great suggestions and lots of info about the area. There was a pool that was so well disguised by gorgeous plants, shrubbery and lots of birds that you felt you were somewhere else. There was also a coin laundry room which we used and were glad to be able to do laundry as were others. The rooms themselves were excellent. We had 2 queens and the beds were so comfortable and lots of pillows and everything was clean. (Trust me, I checked under the beds!) You could walk to the Old part of town in a few minutes where there were lots of stores and excellent restaurants. From there you could also take a variety of transit to other places. We felt very safe walking around during the day and evening. We found the Old Town Inn to be very centrally located to everything. We enjoyed our stay there very much and hope we can go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: ToulaGirl
Reviews.Content: The knowledgeable and extremely helpful staff at the Old Town Inn are the epitome of excellence in customer service. The spanish themed rooms and lobby were tidy and appealing, the price an absolute blessing, and the complimentary breakfast the best we have ever experienced for variety and efficiency. Everyone from the care takers to the room attendants to the amazing front desk staff were readily available to answer any questions whatsoever and were extremely well educated in the area. Justa short walk from historic Old town, where you are transported to old town Cali, full of whimsical shops and amazing eateries. The cab companies they called for us were top notch, they provided valuable suggestions for using the nearby trolleys and public transit, and all in all made our first trip to San diego unforgettable. We will remember the spoiling we received from the staff for a long time to come. Stay here - you will not regret it !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Shabob20
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week staying at the Old Town Inn in San Diego. Hotel was easy to find, right on Highway 1 so you can't go wrong. Registration was quick and easy and we were in our room within 5 minutes. We were in an economy room in a separate block but that has no reflection on the quality of room. There was only 2 of us so the room size was very adequate with plenty of drawers and hanging space for clothing. We had a bathroom with a shower only. The shower was a great size and there were plenty of towels and toileteries. Also, as we were staying more than 4 nights we received an amenities pack which came in very handy. Tip about hairdryer, the bathroom light needs to be on for it to work - how daft did I feel saying hair dryer didn't work. The breakfast which is provided is great, waffles, bagels, cereals, fruit, juice and hot drinks etc. Always plenty of food and regularly replenished. The staff are excellent, nothing was a problem and their knowledge of the local area is brilliant. You can book tickets with them for the different parks and also trolley tours. We didn't use the pool area but it was cleaned regularly and looked like a good place for a wind down after a long, leisurely day around San Diego. It doesn't matter if you are driving to the hotel or flying in, the location is easy to find and not too far from airport (approx 5-10 mins taxi ride). We wanted to be near the Old Town and you only have to walk out of the hotel cross at the lights, under the subway and you are on the edge of the Old Town (5 mins). Felt very safe walking around in the dark. Also, the transport terminus is just by the subway, buses, trams, trains and taxis so no problem if you want to get to other areas of San Diego. Would not hesitate to return to the Old Town Inn in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Trip Advisor You were right on the money!”
Reviews.Author: stjans520
Reviews.Content: Thank You Trip Advisor Members. I was looking for a hotel in San Diego that was decent, clean, and with a breakfast. I went off of what other members said on here, and also it was AAA/CAA approved. The check in was easy. The rooms were clean, and it was nice having a sink outside of the bathroom! The breakfast was amazing! We stayed there for 3 nights and ate the make your own belgian waffle every morning! The rest of the breakfast was great. I know my dad enjoyed going down and meeting new friends every morning. The staff was extremely friendly and was always there to help. The pool looked clean, but we didn't use it. They also had relatively good wireless high speed internet. I thought it might be a problem with the airport being so close but it was quiet inside the room. The grounds were always clean. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: adventures60
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Old Town Inn and found it to be a very quiet and comfortable hotel. The bathroom is conveniently designed and the beds comfortable. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful and someone was always available for questions. The breakfast was good with fruits, cereals, Belgian waffles and various breads. The orange juice was extra good as was the coffee. No hot breakfast was available, however, they plan to have one soon. A big plus for this hotel was its location. It's very close to the Old Town Transit Station making public transportation on the trolley and bus easily available. We were able to park the vehicle for nearly our whole trip and got around just fine. The trolleys are quite entertaining to ride! I'm confident in recommending this hotel. We'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Wtrmlngurl
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed at the Old Town Inn for 5 days in the beginning of December. Here are my comments: *Property & Location-Very cute buildings, the location is kinda weird and desolate feeling (especially at night) but for the price I am not complaining! We upgraded for an extra $10 a night and stayed in the newer section which seemed much nicer. The pool was lovely as well as the beautiful landscaping. We took the Trolley downtown (blue line) most days which is an easy walk (easy walk to old town as well) and easy to navigate. (FYI-the pamphlets recommend Old Town Mexican Cafe-not really that good and pretty expensive-seems like a tourist trap) *Breakfast was supplied everyday, got a little repetitive but was a nice money saver and kick-off to the day *Staff-Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. We bought our zoo tickets at the front desk to get a discount. Hotel room- We got a room with a big bathroom and two queens which was definitely worth the extra money when the laundry and souvenirs started piling up. Everything about the room was fine with the exception of a squeaky floor (which gave us something to laugh about) I think overall that people our age (mid twenties) might be better suited at a hotel downtown as more of our activities were focused closer to the city and not as much on other areas of San Diego (mission valley, la jolla) which the old town inn IS very central too ( it seemed as though we were the youngest guests too). Also, younger people might not find the closest neighborhood, old town, as interesting especially since there is not much going on at night(that we could see), with the exception of Harney's, a hipster sushi restaurant. Overall the stay was good, the close proximity of the trolley (and some rides from friends) meant we avoided having to get a rental car which was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a Motel!”
Reviews.Author: JayDeefromBramalea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we went to San Diego and Old Town for the weekend recently. This place is hidden jewel! Very well kept - everything is in immaculate condition: paint and decor, furnishings etc. although the floors were a bit squeeky in our (older economy) rooms. Up keep and cleanliness are excellent throughout. The complimentary breakfast buffet was excellent - not the usual bare bones fare. They kept refilling and replenishing right up 'till the supposed cutoff time - not like other places where they start putting things away well before closing time. We did not feel rushed or "encouraged" to hurry up as the breakfast was do to close. It is about a 5 minute walk to the San Diego trolley station and San Diego Old Town. Great location if you intend to tour Old Town!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay, nothing fancy but gets all the basics right”
Reviews.Author: Garak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn for one night and liked the place. Its location is what made us choose the inn since it is ever so close to the old town (walking distance). The staff was friendly enough (for US standards possibly a little bit on the reserved side) and the rooms were clean and the bed comfortable. This is not the place where you go for a luxurious weekend break or a special treat. It’s simply a place that gets all the basics right and hence deserves to stayed at. The breakfast was fine, nothing special but nevertheless we enjoyed making our own waffles which tasted pretty good. All in all, I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our refuge after busy days of sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: pilgrimNwWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego with my 80-year old mother and reserved a room for 3 nights based on past reviews on this site. After one day, I canceled another previously made reservation for our last night in San Diego (later in the week) and stayed here instead. We found the inn to be exceptionally clean and pleasant and the staff very friendly and helpful in all regards. The breakfast was great and included many options including fresh fruit, waffles, cereal, bagels, etc. The inn is easy to find, but initially seems isolated in sort of an industrial setting. However, it is actually a very safe location and extremely convenient to accessing Old Town and also to zipping downtown, to the Harbor area, Seaport Village and the airport. Access to I-5 and I-8 are also within 2 blocks. I would definitely stay here again when visiting San Diego. The room rates cannot be beat for such clean, convenient and great accommodations in a larger size city (with my mother's AARP card our rate was approximately $76.00 per night including taxes).

Reviews.Title: “best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: mekeni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights to tour San Diego and Tijuana. The room is clean the continental breakfast is adequate, wireless internet connection is free ! The best thing about this inn are the staff, I would commend them for being the most helpful, down-to-earth and friendliest staff we've eer dealt with. Bravo ! Old town Inn, you sure made a lot of people feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fotrestsidelady
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a few days in San Diego. It is within 5 minutes walk of Old Town and also trains and buses to all parts of the city and has plenty of parking. Do not be put off when you arrive as it appears to be in a nondescript location. However once you get your bearings you will realise what a gem it is in terms of location and the hotel itself - very clean rooms ,beds and linen, a lovely pool , laundromat facilities, complimentary breakfast and friendly and helpful staff. We stayed for 4 nights and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly and really nice, what a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Maiz
Reviews.Content: Traveling with our dog, we didn't have a lot of choices, so we booked this hotel from the road, sight unseen. What a pleasant surprise to find it clean and comfortable as well as reasonably priced. The room was immaculate (if a little small), the lobby was welcoming and tasteful and the staff, friendly and polite. There's a decent continental breakfast and internet service included as well. Next time we go to San Diego we will most definitely stay here again, with or without the dog.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: crabbyharper
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on previous reviews on Trip Advisor. The reviews were, for the most part, right on! The motel was clean, comfortable, quiet (believe it or not!) and the staff were very nice. It struck me as a motel, not a chain, that someone owned and was proud of. I asked at the desk and found that this IS a family owned - for 3 generations - place. The room we had was spacious and comfortable. The continental breakfast had what we look for - good cereal, fruit, coffee and juice - all served in a cheerful sunny room over looking the pool. We did not want to rent a car, so this location was perfect. We could walk to Old Town, where we dined. The motel does not have a dining room, and indeed does not need it. Also in Old Town was the San Diego Trolley Tour, and the public trolley. And the price was amazingly low. When we return to San Diego, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The revews are right: A great, no-frills property”
Reviews.Author: chadarizona
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Old Town Inn based on the rave reviews the property has received on TripAdvisor as a no-frills, inexpensive place to stay in San Diego. As stated in other reviews, the property offers a choice between newer rooms, and "economy" rooms that are in the older part of the hotel. Since I was traveling to town for a conference, and was on a budget, I stayed in an older, economy room for $79 per night. The room and furnishings were older, but fine. The staff was very friendly, professional, and helpful at checkin. I did have one issue with the property. The wireless network device thought I was using too much bandwidth (I was updating some files on a web server) and blocked my MAC address. I spent quite a bit of time over several days getting the issue resolved, but I must say that they were very helpful in getting it taken care of. The last night of my stay, there was a note slipped under my door from the manager apologizing for the problem and offering to remove one night's charges from my bill. If you are visiting San Diego on a budget, I highly recommend the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Love Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumBM
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this property. I love the friendliness of the staff, always accomadting. The rooms can range for basic to a more spacious bungalow. The price is excellent which includes continental breakfast, perfect to get you through the morning. The rooms are always clean and comfortable (bed a little hard, but not awful). Also has a pool to cool you off mid day. Perfect location. Walking distance to Old Town, and Trolley. I would definetly recommend this place to anyone who doesn't want to sacrifice comfort for price.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: snowbeltCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn in San Diego for three nights in October - what a great little inn. The price was great and the staff at the front desk were so friendly - they went out of their way to give directions, help you decide what sights to see and provide tickets at a discount. The breakfast room was not too busy and constantly re-stocked and tidied up while you ate. Continental breakfast had lots of selection and there was coffee, tea, water and pastries available in the lobby all day. The inn was next to the train/bus station with only a short walk to Old Town. The intestate was close but the rooms were not noisy at all. The pool area was beautiful and peaceful - you could even eat breakfast out there if the breakfast room was crowded. They even had a barbecue out there. We would stay there again in a minute because of the price and the great service and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: VTer24
Reviews.Content: Based upon the reviews in Tripadvisor, we booked 3 nights at the Old Town Inn. You cannot beat the location. Walking distance to the transportation center so it is easy to catch a trolley downtown if desired. A 5 minute walk to Old Town. 5 minute drive to return rental car before proceeding on to the airport. The place was a great value. It was clean (although the bed was too soft), staff was very helpful. We had to leave at 4:30 a.m. to catch a flight, so the staff allowed us to do the paperwork for check-out the night before. Breakfast was good and parking was free. Great location, little traffic and a good, clean basic room which was quiet. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Check out the Jacuzzi Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Store_Finder
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego on a quick business trip and elected to stay at the Old Town Inn, as I have stayed there before. It is a great little hotel and it is a very good value. It is extremely well located to both downtown, and all attractions around San Diego. When I checked in, the friendly young lady at the counter asked if I would be interested in their new Jacuzzi Suite. She explained that they have completely redone a larger room, and added a Jacuzzi Spa Tub, as well as a walk in shower with both a Rain Showerhead and a Handheld shower head. As it had been a long day, I thougt that a Jacuzzi sounded great before I went to bed. Good choice. The room looked like it was out of one of the highrise hotels in downtown, with a great decor, soothing colors, and it even had a flatscreen TV! Needless to say, after a hot soak with a drink, I was ready for bed. The bed also was excellent with lots of pillows, and great bedding. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: dudekarma
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed here. I was concerned because our room was alongside a main road but the noise was not an issue. Our room was nice. The pool was nice and the staff were good also. Breakfast was adequete (cereals, toast and pastries). We were given amenity kits when we checked in and the quality of the products was good. I used the laundrey and it was hassle free (and better value than other places we stayed). The location was also handy to Seaworld and the City. We had a car but there is a train station nearby. This was a good palce, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations for the Budget Traveller and great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller55555_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days after our Mexican Riviera Cruise. We booked based on reviews on this website and the price. We stayed in a room that had 2 queen size beds, separate wash basin and granite counter outside bathroom that had its own wash basin and shower/tub. The corner unit room on the 3rd floor was clean and large. No refrigerator. All room doors face an outside corridor. The Inn is on Pacific Highway but I didn't hear much noise. It is also situated in a commercial/industrial area. The area is quiet at night but did not feel uncomfortable walking in the area at night. I started looking for rooms in May but didn't book room until September. Because I didn't book early enough I originally couldn't get 5 consecutive nights in the same room. My initial booking ended up with us having to move 3 times. The staff was courteous enough to phone me the next day (without me requesting) to inform me they had a room available for 5 straight nights. Paid approximately $100 per night with AAA discount. Standard continental breakfast with 2 waffle makers, bread, bagels, fruit cocktail, cereals, orange juice, coffee, tea, etc. The front counter staff was friendly and helpful. The front counter had discount tickets on sale for some of the attractions. For example, an adult zoo ticket for $30.00. They also provided complimentary toiletries such as toothpaste should you run out. The only complaints I have are the following: 1)internet access on the free computer was slow (minor detail) 2)you can't book through the internet even though they have a website. However, there is a toll free number. Once you told the staff what your requirements were, they would email you back to confirm your reservation. The response time was quick. Old Town Inn's location was central for our needs given that the transportation hub that was approximately 300 yards away (across the street and commuter parking lot). The bus and trolley system takes you to all the tourist sites - Gaslamp district, downtown, beaches, La Jolla, zoo, SeaWorld, Fashion Valley and Mission shopping malls, etc. including the border next to Tiajuana. The outlet mall Las Americas is also next to the border less than 1/2 mile from the last trolley bus stop at the border. The Old Town tourist site is on the other side of the transportation hub approximately 200 yards away. Waiting time for regular buses was usually less than 10 minutes (daytime). Trolley bus waiting time was less. HINT: Buy a day pass good for the trolley and bus. One day adult pass is $5.00, 2 day is $9.00, 3 day is $12.00 and 4 day is $15.00. You can buy the pass at any kiosk /terminal or at the convenience store at the transportation hub. Restaurants We ate at the Coyote Cafe and Old Town Mexican Cafe in Old Town. Restaurants are next to each other. Food was good. Little Italy Restaurant - Filippi's. Restaurant entrance is through the deli. (3 trolley stops from Old Town). Good food at a fair price. Always crowded. Go early or late to avoid lineups. Gaslamp District - Sloppy Joey's - pizza and pasta. Food was okay. Phil's BBQ on Sports Arena Boulevard - good food - chicken, beef and pork ribs, etc. Less than 1.5 miles from Old Town Inn Other Info: Taxi cab from cruise terminal to Old Town Inn - approx. $14.00 before tip. Cab to airport approx. the same price - $14.00 before tip Some of the Balboa Park museums had free admission on Tuesdays.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dave12345
Reviews.Content: Overall great stay here. The location is excellent, 2 minutes walk from the Old Town trolley / bus station and they offer free parking if you have a car. The first room we stayed in did have a slightly strange smell (think it was the cleaning products mentioned in the review below). We were only booked in for one night originally but extended our stay by another 5 nights and moved to a different room after the first night (as our original room was booked after that night) which did not have the smell at all. The rooms are extremely clean and well maintained and there was a fridge and microwave in the room. There are also wasing machines / tumble driers on site. The pool area is nicely kept and the water in the pool was warm. The front desk is well organised - they have pre-printed driving / walking / bus / trolley directions to all the major sites in San Diego as well as local places such as nearest convenience store / atm / petrol station. The best thing about this place however is the staff. Everyone on the front desk was friendly and really went out of their way to help us with directions and suggestions for places to go / see / eat at which really improved our stay so thanks to everyone there - would definately stay here again if I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: GOBLIN62
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn, San Diego California Joann Esser, Contact Person Our Navy Reunion group stayed at this little quaint and beautifully keep hotel for a full seven days. The staff at the hotel was excellent in every way. They were very helpful with directions, purchasing tickets and just general information. Everyone was os nice and willing to help. We also appreciated the use of the breakfast room for a meeting point and a little get together which accomodated everyone nicely. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to San Diego. The access Old Town and all the trolly's, AMTRAK, and City Bus tours is very convient and within walking distance. The Hotel itself was in excellent condition and everything was keep very clean. I cannot say enough about the staff. They were excellent to work with. Anna Flores, Front Desk Manager was very efficient, polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value at a superb location”
Reviews.Author: chiliapple
Reviews.Content: The room was fairly decent -- clean, comfortable. Furnishings are a bit dated but this did not matter to us. Amenities were supplied the first night, but were replenished once only over a 3 night stay. It was a good thing I always bring my stocked toiletry bag. There was an area specifically for storing luggage, which was good if you plan to do shopping. Front desk was helpful in assisting us on how to get to specific destinations/sightseeing areas. Free internet at the lobby was great! Although terminals are limited and often you'll have to wait. Breakfast was included in the room rate, and it was great value! There was a wide selection, and we especially enjoyed to make-your-own-waffle station. It's walking distance to the trolley station and the Old Town. Parking was also free. Will definitely stay here again the next time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it´s very well!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower1503
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn is very nice, small hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The pool is great. The location of the hotel is also nice. (near Old Town). Only the breakfast was not my favourite, but ok. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It´s really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeno66
Reviews.Content: Great price and close to all we wanted to do. Our room was ready before promised,clean and comfortable. It was not huge but comfortable for the 2 of us. It is located near OLD TOWN(5 min. walk).All transit is located within that 5 min. walk too.We stayed 3 nights and had a great time in San Diego. Would stay again if in tha San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Indepently owned. And it shows!”
Reviews.Author: DoeHEAD
Reviews.Content: At the risk of gilding the lily, I must join the legions who have remarked about their positive experiences at the Old Town Inn. I arrived in San Diego with a reservation for one night only. I was anticipating having to return to the city two weeks later for two additional nights, but hadn't made any plans about where I'd stay upon returning; figuring I could figure that out once I was in California. I'd looked at lots of San Diego hotels on-line before I went west, and wasn't satisfied that I'd found something that covered all the bases for a reasonable price. One night staying at the Old Town Inn, however, convinced me of the obvious wisdom of making a reservation to return there when I came back into town. The location is a big part of its appeal: handy to the airport, walkable to the Blue Line Trolley and Historic Old Town with its restaurants and shopping, easy nearby access to I-5, I-8, Point Loma, Presidio Hill Park, Mission Beach, Sea World, downtown. The hotel's own service and amenities are also nothing to sneeze at, with charming flower-filled grounds, beautiful pool, friendly and eager-to-help staff. I needed border-crossing advice for a trolley visit to Tijuana. Done. I needed directions for getting to Cabrillo National Monument. Done. I needed an early-morning wake-up and ride to the airport. Done...and not just a taxi, but a Town Car that charged me a flat fare ($16) and was waiting for me ten minutes PRIOR to when I needed it. The rooms are smaller than a standard chain hotel-by-the-Interstate room. But both of mine were clean, comfortable and quiet, despite being adjacent to a multi-lane road. I'd eagerly return to the Old Town Inn. It's value is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: gram4020
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a fantastic week at the Old Town Inn in San Diego from 1st September. It took around 10-15 minutes cab ride from the Airport. When we arrived we were checked in quickly and given printed details of how to use public transport to most of the tourist attractions. This was great for us as we decided not to drive on this trip. They also gave us printed walking directions to local stores. Very useful. Our room was a basic room, but perfectly adequate for us. Clean with queen bed, good size shower, air con,fridge and microwave.It was serviced every day. The Old Town Inn provides a free continental breakfast, which was just right for setting us up for the day ahead. It also has a lovely pool area, which we used every day. It was such a pleasure coming back after a long day to spend an hour or two in the pool. The staff were wonderful. They couldn't have been more helpful. As I said, we didn't drive. This wasn't a problem as the public transport was brilliant, and to us Brits, very cheap. We loved our time in San Diego & loved the Old Town Inn. I will definitely try to book again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Robian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used the Old Town Inn as a base for three days of sightseeing in San Diego and loved it. The rooms were large and very clean, and the staff helpful and friendly. It's an easy walk to Old Town where it seemed that all of San Diego went to dine on Saturday evening! There appeared to be a bus/trolley stop on our way to Old Town - maybe 3 minutes from the hotel? Being right beside Old Pacific Hwy we wondered about noise but our room was quiet at night thanks to good insulation and air conditioning. Wished that the pool had been heated and that they'd included hard-cooked eggs in their breakfast (guess that would change the room rate!)... but these are pretty minor things. We definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: justjoe2003
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Stayed in the original section of the hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. If you are looking for a high quality, inexpensive place to stay, this is it. Staff was extremely friendly and helpfull, a definate cutsomer focused hotel. I really enjoyed my stay. this is the only place I will stay when I am visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CARocks
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn had great reviews on tripadvisor and did not disappoint. We had a wonderful stay there. The rooms were clean and the staff were very friendly and answered all our questions. We even got a discount when we talked to a staff member and mentioned that we were from San Jose...and found out that it was his hometown too! We also received a welcome packet when we checked in, a little bag with travel goodies....shampoo/conditioner, disposable razors etc....that was a nice touch! All in all, we totally enjoyed our stay here. And very budget-friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Just as advertised!”
Reviews.Author: David56Chicago
Reviews.Content: We read thru the Tripadvisor articles and decided to try this place and were we ever glad! Rooms were not great but clean with ironing board, staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect for visiting San Diego. Don't miss Old Town, it's great! We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Old Town Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Mom2TwinsJK
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself & our 7 year old twins stayed for 4 days. This was our first time at Old Town Inn. We found it via online searches for affordable hotels that were near Sea World & this property was consistently rated highly. We made reservations via contacting Old Town Inn directly & Ana was detailed, patient & very attentive (as we have a child in a wheelchair). We were able to reserve their wheelchair room (which is more spacious, especially in the bathrooms). They made accomodations for a shower chair & in-room mini fridge/microwave (a necessity for storing medications). When we arrived, check-in was quick & simple. We had a few minor complications arise during our stay & Reuben took care of each of them promptly & followed up with us as well. Check out was quick & easy also. The staff was incredibly accomodating, attentive & polite. Breakfast was great too, especially considering it was free! Their site is so central to Old Town, Seaport Village, Mission Bay, Sea World & La Jolla. My kids also enjoyed swimming in their pool. We are already planning to return to this site for our next San Diego vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A True Review”
Reviews.Author: riceman1818
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights starting Aug. 19, 2008 in order to take in 3 of S.D. parks. We mainly booked this property because of all the glowing reviews. Overall we found the place pretty nice, but there were a few things on the negative side. First, the breakfast is very basic and never changed. Yes, they do have waffles that are hot off the grill because it is a do-it-yourself operation. My grandson had the waffles. My wife had the fresh fruit and I had the cereal all three days. I did miss perhaps one hot egg dish, such as scrambled eggs or containers of yougart would have been nice. Also, the breakfast room is just not big enough for all the people staying at the Inn. We found the parking lot to have very narrow parking spaces. Overall we found San Diego to have very narrow parking spaces thoughout the city. Our room #113 had 2 queen beds and was good size for the 3 of us. I also missed not having a small frig in our room. I feel the price & location were excellent and I would rate their cleaniness & staff helpfulness as excellent. Would I stay their again? I would say most likely YES.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: leeseloo
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a week and really enjoyed our stay. rooms were clean and pretty large. complimentary breakfast was a great start to every morning, lots of choice-wish i could have found the waffle mix to bring home though. pool area clean and so nice to be able to have a dip up until 10pm. hotel is in a brilliant location for exploring, its a 5 minute walk to the trolley train which will take you all over. fit in a padres game if you get chance, great family experience. restaurants in old town are good, avoid eating around 8 though at weekends as queues build up quickly. would recommend this hotel to anyone. staff were more than helpful and hot coffee and iced water always available. my only criticism is there is no fridge in the room, but never mind, there are ice machines. very enjoyable experience!

Reviews.Title: “The only thing outstanding was the price... but that was enough!”
Reviews.Author: OhNoHolio
Reviews.Content: We booked the family suite for our family of four. Mid week was $165 a night... which is truly a bargain for what we got!! The room was huge, the equivalent of two regular rooms connected by french doors. The main room had plenty of space with a couch, two chairs, coffee table, small dining table, t.v. armoire, and a tiny but well-stocked kitchen that included a small fridge and microwave. The other room held two queen beds, a small chair, a t.v armoire, and a storage armoire - yet we STILL had room for our twins' pack-n-plays! The room was very clean, but the soft surfaces felt slightly damp. No mildew smell, though. The included breakfast was only OK - pretty much exactly what you would expect from a low-to-mid-range hotel. Check in and check out were without problems, but that was the only interaction we had with the staff. We'll probably stay here the next time we go to San Diego to visit family, because the prices can't be beat for what you get. Overall, though, I'd say the glowing reviews here on Trip Advisor are a bit over the top. Maybe people were just so excited by the excellent rates?

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pamlyn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The location is great; near SeaWorld and Downtown San Diego. Free Continental breakfast with stay.....Danishes, bagels, fruit, tea, coffee, make-your-own waffle, muffins.....wonderful! Next time I come to san diego, I will stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Surudo
Reviews.Content: We were bringing an out-of-town visitor and were so alarmed by the low prices ($80 midweek in San Diego has to be a dump, right?) that we actually drove down to check it out before we booked. We couldn't have been more impressed. The lobby is attractive, the grounds nicely landscaped and the pool sparkling clean. The location couldn'y be handier. It is just across the street from the transportation hub and a short walk (maybe a block and a half) from there to Old Town. The cheaper rooms are in the old section of the motel. They are small, but charming, with an old-fashioned feel that positively entranced our visiting friend. Everything was immaculately clean. The staff is amazing. The clerks at the desk are friendly and helpful, and there was always someone watering the plants and tidying up. Breakfast is better than usual, the breakfast room is pleasant, and again the staff was very much in evidence. Coffee and ice water are available all day. There is even a big pitcher of water with lemons! They think of everything. I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, a little bit on the other side of the tracks”
Reviews.Author: jrzgrlsailor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really clean, the room was very nice, there was a pool and a better than aveage selecton at the complimentary breakfast. Staff was alsovery friendly. Room rate was higher than 90$, more like 140$ for one night. only down side was the hotel was lterally on the other side of the tracks and a bit out of the way. There was a police raid on the property next door the night I was there. It was failry close to old town and the airport though.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Kristina_www
Reviews.Content: Very nice and quiet hotel. There is a swimming pool quite clean, we were not afraid to go in. They offer free parking, tea and coffee all day long, free breakfast wich is good and the buffet never empty. Rooms are nice but small. It is located not far away from the Old Town (10mn walk) but you have to drive 15 mn to San Diego center.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay......”
Reviews.Author: jcphotog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two weeks July 2008 as we did in July 2007. There cannot be enough said about the friendliness of the staff from the front desk to the folks doing the maintenance. If you needed something or some help they would do what they could to meet the need. Simple things where a given such as room cleanliness. We are very fussy about cleanliness. We stayed in the same room both years. It was quiet and comfortable. The location of the Inn is perfect. It is less than 10 minutes north of the San Diego airport, across the street from a main Trolley station. There is shopping and food available nearby along with the Old Town Mission area. Access to highway 5 and 8 is easy and close. We have stayed in a number of hotels during the 9 summers we have gone to San Diego for vacation. This is by far the best in all aspects. It should also be noted that Beatriz Cadena, the General Manager, was easily accessable and very friendly. When we spoke about her crew you could see pride on her face. We obviously recommend this facility. Thanks to everyone there.....

Reviews.Title: “Once again a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: bikingsanity
Reviews.Content: This is the second summer that we have spent approximately two weeks at Old Town Inn while vacationing in San Diego. I cannot tell you how pleased we are with this establishment. The employees are extremely helpful and friendly,and the rooms and grounds are spotless and beautifully landscaped.They have a laundry facility and a beautiful pool. Not one day goes by that the staff is not working hard to maintain the property and making your visit an enjoyable one. It is located within walking distance of the trolley station and is only about 10 minutes from the airport. You can't get more convenient than that. We have already booked our room for next July! Thanks to the staff ! You helped make our vacation a very enjoyable one!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but pricey @ certain times of year...”
Reviews.Author: yiujun
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Old Town Inn from Jul 23-24, 2008. I have previously called the hotel directly to book a room for two adults, and was given a price quote and a reservation number. Due to some miscommunication, I was booked for a room for Jun 23 and 24 instead of Jul. I was quoted around 150 bucks for 2 nights over the phone, and did not receive any other confirmation after that. When I arrived at the hotel on Jul 23, the person at the counter told me that I booked for Jun, and since I have missed my booking they had charged me 170 bucks for not showing up. Apparently, that was the price for "one night". They didn't have any vacancy either, and would not let me use the hotel phone to see if there are any other vacancies in the area. Instead they directed me to the pay phone outside the hotel, which ate up our 75 cents, the last of our change. I was really frustrated, since I have planned the trip that does not account for any delays such as this. We had no more change to call hotels, I was out 170 bucks, and I had no place to stay. Finally they told us that they had one room that they can let us stay in. It was 170 bucks a night, since the Comic-Con was in town. So from an average of 90/night to 170/night. Desperate for a place to stay, we took their offer. But let's just say that we were not happy campers. But to be fair, aside from that, the stay was more than pleasant. The room was nice and clean, the bed was so big that it felt impractical (you could fit 3 adults on it) and it was comfy. The breakfast was ok, with bagels, waffles, toast, stuff like that. Someone helps you make the waffles too if you don't want to do it yourself. When we checked out, I talked to the GM, Beatriz, about my 170 penalty for "not showing up when I was supposed to". I had booked for Jul, not Jun, but I got charged 170 bucks! I was quoted 150 then, even if they were going to charge me, why did I get charged for more? Beatriz immediately fixed that for me by putting the money back on my credit card and apologized for the mistake. And with that, I left the hotel quite satisfied with the overall service and quality of the hotel. Although I think the younger staff they hired (like the teenage front desk girl that first helped me when I checked in on Jul 23) needs some improvement, overall it was a pleasant stay. I'd recommend it. Just remember though that they don't send out email confirmations so you should definitely call in again before your trip to double check that you were booked for the right dates.

Reviews.Title: “How very lovely!”
Reviews.Author: mundi_ba
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Old Town Inn. Never been to San Diego (or CA, actually) before this trip, and it was quite lovely. The Old Town Inn is, I think, what a good American motel should be - convenient parking, large, clean and well-maintained room, very decent breakfast, the usual coffee maker, great service. What else should one expect? Well, the Inn gives you all of these. two more remarks: first, as to location. Granted, the Inn is not located in downtown San Diego. whn first arriving We were actually a little worried about the surroundings. But, although it's right next to a major road and the adjacent lot is occupied by a huge Marines depot of some sort, it's not a problem at all. the Inn itself is quiet and pleasent, and accross that major road, a minute's walk, is the Old Town, which is really sweet, and has a few excellent mexican restaurants, and also the Old Town transit station where you can find all the public transportation you need to get to other places in San Diego, and we had a wonderful experience with the public transport staff and the locals, who were all extremely patient and helpful. So, do not be daunted by that 200 yard walk across the road and the parking lot, it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jke38
Reviews.Content: We had our kitchen remodeled and needed a place to stay while they sprayed laquer (Cough, cough) on the cabinets. A friend recommended the Old Town Inn and it was perfect! Quiet, comfortable (best hotel bed i've slept on), with all the goodies we needed; breakfast, wireless internet, iron and board, coffee in the room, etc. The staff was very friendly...we even got a late check out! The location was unique but since we are familiar with the area we felt completely safe. For what we paid and what we got I think they deserve six stars. It's not for someone who is used to paying $300+ for a hotel room, but we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved every minute!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ronette79
Reviews.Content: After reading the excellent reviews in regards to the inn, I decided to cancel other hotel accomodations and take a chance with Old Town Inn... Boy, where we ever lucky!!!!! We arrived to a very warm welcome and a very clean room!!!! The bathrooms are sized just perfect for a family of four... Our room was cleaned daily and our used towels were replaced with clean fresh ones as well... The free complimentary breakfast was a true time and money saver because being on vacation in sunny San Diego, you are bound to spend money else where!!!! The manager, Anna is very sweet and the staff there are helpful and courteous as well... Overall, my husband and I were so pleased that if we decided to cruise out of San Diego for next year's vacation, we will be staying at the Old Town Inn again.... Please note, that if you are looking for a general HOTEL like experience, this is not the place for you... But, if you are looking for a nicely priced, quiet little place, with free breakfast (bagels, juice, ceral, etc.), comfortable rooms and a great staff, this is the place!!!! Thank you Old Town Inn for making our stay a safe and economical one.... The Dawson Family

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice economy accomodations”
Reviews.Author: lakecogal
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at The Old Town Inn in San Diego. If you are looking for a smaller, economical motel, away from the bustle of "Motel Row", this is the place. It was clean, comfortable, and reasonable. The location was great if you have a car. The grounds are nice with many flowers and plants. The continental breakfast was slightly above average. The staff very nice and accommodating. We stayed in the economy wing, which is an older part of the motel, but it was perfectly adequate for our needs, with a quiet comfortable place as our number one priority.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Value and Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: hadrian333
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a good hotel. Pros: 1. Courteous Staff 2. Great free breakfasst 3. Great Location 4. Reasonable Price 5. Clean Room Cons: 1. Limited Parking 2. Uncomfortable Bed 3. Damp Bed perhaps due to high humidity? Turning on AC didn't help. 4. Very limited TV channels and no Pay per view., My remote was missing the battery cover. 5. Only 1 internet access in lobby. If you want a clean hotel with limited amenities, this hotel is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Fabulous, Family-Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: wdennis5
Reviews.Content: A totally awesome hotel in Old Town San Diego. Very clean and great service. Best kept secret in San Diego. I have already recommended this hotel to other people. Also, the prive is budget-friendly. And don't let that scare you!

Reviews.Title: “DID NOT FEEL SAFE, not worth the discount!!!”
Reviews.Author: EAAJ04
Reviews.Content: The worst experience!!! We traveled with our two children a 2yr & 4yr old to San Diego for a quick and inexpensive getaway. We had a great time at Petco Park, lots of giggles, laughter and of course great baseball. Our room @ Old Town Inn was gross, the carpet was dirty and sticky. The walls were paper thin, heard the couple next door fight all night. The staff was not very friendly when we complained. We couldn't wait to get out of there. The hotel location was not safe, it's in the middle of an industrial center, everyone has access to the property. Never again would we stay here, even if it's FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of choice for our family”
Reviews.Author: rosyuma
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews and from them I chose this hotel. We got the Family Suite for a very good price. Two nights under 400. I brought along my pet (Shih-Tzu Pup) and had no problems. $ 15 dollars extra. Staff was very friendly, Breakfast buffet was a great deal and the pool looked inviting but weather was too cold for us to take a dip. I was very pleased with the room and will definetly make this my hotel of choice when in San Diego. Old Town is just 2 blocks away and Sea World is just a short 7 minute drive. You cant beat the price, location, staff and decent rooms. They even gave us silverware in our room. Couldn't be more pleased. p.s. lots of storage space.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE AND HOSPITALITY”
Reviews.Author: JOHNNYSOTO
Reviews.Content: OLD TOWN INN, SAN DIEGO, CA. 921110 DATE: JUNE 15, 2008 REVIEW: I have received "The best hospitality and service ever in my 25 years staying at different hotels etc. The general manager and her staff have demonstrated such excellence customer service with an attitude of caring and showing great personal skills toward us the customer. "I WANTED TO TAKE THIS TIME TO SHOW MY APPRECIATION AND GIVE HONOR WERE HONER IS DUE", THANK YOU. JOHNNY SOTO

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZ PAUL
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant motel right next to San Diego's Old Town. Very friendly staff, clean but basic room, and great location. Breakfast was included. Staff also provided easy directions from the motel to San Diego's popular attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in San Diego hotels!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotraveltoo3
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Old Town Inn, conveniently located near Old Town in San Diego (just a short walk away!). The hotel is clean, the staff friendly and very helpful - all in all - great service. The complimentary breakfasts every morning included fruits, cereals, juice, coffee and teas, but my sons really enjoyed the boiled eggs and the make-your-own waffle machines(2 of them). The pool area is very attractively surrounded with colorful flowers and trees - usually pretty quiet because everyone is going to SeaWorld, Zoo, etc., and we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel. Our kids enjoyed it. We stayed in the older section and it was just fine! Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in for the money in San Diego, and hard to beat at any level! I am extremely fussy! It is handy to the highways to get to the theme parks, and other sites. The Rock-n-Roll Marathon went right by our hotel when we were there! There are many restaurants are handy and when we were tired of driving somewhere - we just walked over to Old Town and had a blast!!! We also spent our money on food and sites, instead of just lodging! We will DEFINTELY return!

Reviews.Title: “A true oasis in the desert!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bielawski
Reviews.Content: I worked in the hotel industry as a front desk supervisor for four star hotels for more years than I would care to remember. Needless to say I'm observant of staff and surroundings. What can I say but, "BRAVO!!!!!" The entire front desk staff (morning, swing, and night) showed patience and a sense of humor in putting up with my horrible airline issues. To the fabulous maids (man you guys are hard workers and still always have a smile!). To the gardeners (WOW! I liked to hang out at the Ritz Carton at night when I lived in Vegas to enjoy the grounds and you guys reminded me of those wonderfull night walks with my dog.) To the ladies that maintain the breakfast BLESS YOU! (my husband and I missed the time limit twice and both times you went in back and gave what we needed to start another day). To the maintance people THX (yes my husband is a clutz and you fixed our little issue quickly and quietly ;) ). I would like everyone to realize the diamond that your hotel is. This hotel is the one that can't be beat! When others nickel and dime you to death, they don't. Great bang for the buck. ONE REQUEST>>>>Your dryers....Put them out of their misery, they are the worst! It should take ONE cycle to dry NOT three, for one wash.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a gem”
Reviews.Author: tomcat33333
Reviews.Content: San Diego is an expensive place to stay. Old Town is no exception. But there's the Old Town Inn, where you can stay for not a ton of money, and be hosted by a property that seems well above average. The property is situated on Pacific Highway, a busy street, across from what might be considered the entrance to Old Town -- the Old Town Trolley Stop. From there you can get to Old Town itself, or can take the trolley to points throughout SD. Our room was spotless. It had a comfortable bed -- not a pillow-top, but okay. The room was not large, but was very comfortable and welcoming. The bathroom was clean, with a step-in shower stall for those who have trouble getting into a regular one. The front desk staff was prompt and helpful, though they did not have our room ready until 3. That's inconvenient, but nothing worse than they promised. The pool seemed nice, and the landscaping was very well done. In rhe morning, they have a nice breakfast, including fruit, cereal and waffles, as well as the usual pastries. Pacific Highway is busy, and we could hear a bit of traffic from our room, but it was not really disturbing. In short, this an above-average value in a place where it' tough to get a room for under $100. On a holiday weekend, ours came in at almost exactly $100, and we felt fortunate to get it.

Reviews.Title: “This gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TravelhappyEngland
Reviews.Content: We picked this accommodation because it was near to the transit system, just across the road. What a gem it turned out to be. We stayed for ten nights and we were very satisfied. Very reasonably priced, clean and within walking distance of the Historic Old Town and the transit depot for buses and trollies. Throw in an excellent free breakfast and excellent staff, what more could you want to make your trip to San Diego complete. A must if you don't want to hire a car. We would highly recommend the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: WiseOwl79
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights and firstly must say that the hotel is very clean and well kept, the staff was courteous and the room was comfortable. Now here's the "but". The hotel walls are thin and the plumbing is loud, so be prepared to hear the footsteps of the people above you and the showers from the ones next to you. The other patrons of the hotel are rude and loud. Granted not the hotels fault, but what would curb this is security. Twice someone tried to open our door, the first by a loud drunken guest at 3:00 in the Afternoon!?
