The second at 5 AM by yet another drunken guest who was staying directly upstairs having a party ALL Night. There were many guests drinking and smoking outside their rooms. I feel a security guard and some stricter rules on smoking and drinking on the premises would handle these types of people. We had a great time in San Diego, but we'll stay at Hotel Circle next time. We've never had a situation there before.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: StuNayhem
Reviews.Content: What a nice place! I had the pleasure of staying here 4/29-5/1. I was shocked on how nice everything was. Usually you go to a place and the pictures look so much nicer then it is, but in this case it was the opposite. The room was great and in all honesty I think it was just completely renovated. The pool looked great but I did not swim because it was rather cold but it still looked inviting. The lady at the front desk was great, Patty was her name. She helped me out a few times with local knowledge. In all honesty I would not hesitate to stay here again. I do apologize about not writing a quicker review but I took one week off then when I returned I'm behind a month at work. Pat aka Stu

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: westexbarb
Reviews.Content: The staff were all friendly and welcoming. We stayed here for a week and anytime we asked for information or directions, they went out of their way to help us. We stayed in the older, economy part. The rooms were clean and well maintained. We didn't have a car, so we rode the trolley or busses and only had to cross the road to the depot. We will certainly stay here again. Thanks for pointing us in this direction Trip Advisor

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dogdayfilms
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay. I had some second thoughts at the last minute before my trip. How could a place so inexpensive yet with a central location be as good as most reviews were saying? But I stuck with my reservation, and I sure am glad I did. The Old Town Inn was spotless, very cute, comfortable, and very welcoming. The staff were friendly. The double queen deluxe room was not cramped at all, and even the ground floor unit (which I usually hate) was quite nice - every night I was able to park right in front of my door. While nothing fancy, it was what a hotel room should be - clean, quiet, comfortable. I don't need a lot of extras, and I hate paying for things I have no use for. Instead, the place was everything I paid for, and more. The pool was quite nice, very cozy. I imagine it could get crowded if the place was packed, but it is a nice place to unwind. Heated, open 7am - 10pm. All in all, I loved my stay at the Old Town Inn. Will definitely stay there again without hesitation. Kudos to the management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “lesson in guest relations needed”
Reviews.Author: i_dr
Reviews.Content: Great location (near Old Town S.D. and in between Downtown and Sea World/ Mission Beach) clean rooms, good breakfast and reasonable rates. What more could you ask for? Oh yeah, I wish one person manning the front desk- Oki, get a refresher on how to treat guests. When I reported one night that our toilet bowl was clogged, he handed me a plunger and suggested that I do it myself. Tsk, tsk.. To be fair, everyone else was really nice and professional, including the maintenance person who showed up the first thing the next morning to fix the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: ftp1234
Reviews.Content: We came here after spending a day at the Sea World. We just needed 1 night stay, before driving to Vegas next morning. The ladies at the reception desk were friendly, the room was nice and clean. The breakfast had lots of choice and was very good. The hotel is very close to the Sea World and is near the intersection of I-5 and I-8. I would recommend this to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value!”
Reviews.Author: LovezRayne
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to take a getaway for our birthdays down to San Diego since he'd never been. So begins the hunt for a hotel that isn’t scary, that isn’t ghetto, and that doesn’t cost you an arm and a leg (seemingly impossible these days right?) I work at a travel wholesaler so I know the ropes. I hopped online and stumbled upon the Old Town Inn (after several hopefuls but no success). I read the reviews on Trip Advisor, at first I was leery, but I must say the reviews that are ‘good’ couldn’t be truer. I was kind of skeptical about pre-booking and not seeing the property, but after my stay I am glad I relied on others feedback. The property is huge; there is a new section and an old section. Originally, we were going to stay in the new section, but (for the sake of budget) decided we’d take the old section and if it was too gnarly we’d upgrade to the new section. (side note – by staying in the old section we saved $75.00) So we arrived around 11:30am to be greeted by the desk clerk (who was ultra friendly), and he told us check in is normally 3, but our room was ready so he let us check in early at no extra charge. So we head towards our room with fingers crossed and hope for the best, and surprise! It’s the cutest room ever, and more importantly clean! Sleep was good, there was no noise, the bathroom was clean, plenty of towels, breakfast was included – we couldn’t ask for more. If you are in town to see all the attractions, and don’t intend on spending your vacation in the room, this is a great place to stay. If we travel to San Diego again, in the same region – this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet. quaint”
Reviews.Author: Blackwolf1
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here and we would highly recommend it. It was clean and we had a very large room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was very adequate. We would definitely stay here again. It is an excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Very short stay due to bed bugs.....”
Reviews.Author: LAtravel02
Reviews.Content: I referred to trip advisor before choosing a hotel, this hotel had a large number of very complimentary reviews and wonderful pictures. So, I thought this would be a great place to stay while on vacation. My husband and twin girls had planned on going to Sea World, Wild Animal park and legoland. Thankfully we went to Legoland before we checked in at the Oldtown inn. Once we arrived the gentlemen who checked us in was very nice and helpful in directing us to a place to eat. My daughters were settled in and my husband asleep and I was folding clothes to put away since we were going to be staying for another couple of days. I felt something on my side and dismissed this, then I don't know how many minuetes later felt something on my right wrist. I woke my husband up and told him something is not right, he thought that I may be allegeric to the polyester bedspread on top of the bed. He pulled the sheets back and there crawling on the pillow was a bedbug. I ran and woke my daughters put them in the bathroom immediately and went straight downstairs to notify an employee, this was at 1:00 in the morning. The employee followed me up to the room and as we entered my husband was catching the fourth bug, this one crawling across the bed my daughters just moments before were sleeping in. The employee did find us another hotel and we arrived there at 3:30 A.M.and another employee called to check on me and my daughter (in total 23 bites) the company paid for an office visit and throw in tickets to seaworld for good measure. All in all they were nice but at the end of the day our vacation was ruined, my daughter complained about the itching constantly and I can't blame her I was feeling the same thing. We couldn't sleep in the new hotel because we kept thinking that we might have "carried" some over from the Old town Inn. Although, it seemed to be clean in the lobby, and the room appeared to be clean...you just never know. Anyone thinking of staying here or any other hotel, check your mattresses, sheets, pillows. These bugs are extremely hard to get rid of and my hope is that we have not "carried" these things to the new hotel or our home. I do have photos but am choosing not to share them as I am posting this to alert everyone that this is a problem and everyone should be made aware of the danger. It is a couple of days later and I am still itching, and having to apply cream, my daughter is miserable. Certainly, not what we expected on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: sandiegogirl10
Reviews.Content: My daughter goes to USD and I go down to visit her several times during the year. I came across this hotel in the AAA book and called due to the close proximity to her school and the great advertised rates. I have always encountered friendly staff and great service. The last time I was down there, in early March, there was a slight mix-up with a room I had requested. When I informed the employee of the dilemma, they upgraded my room for no extra charge. Usually I just stay in a small room with one bed, but I was upgraded to a suite! It had a kitchen (stove, microwave, refrigerator), a King size bed, a couch, and a large bathroom. While the extra space was not necessary, it was nice to know that the hotel values my service as a customer. This is a great hotel for families, as there is a nice pool area and a kid friendly breakfast. It is also located close to many attractions such as Old Town, Sea World, Fashion Valley Mall, and downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: kjoann
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a spotless room, large free breakfast, and very friendly people at a $90-$100 range, this is the place. We reserved a king room in the newer section. (Room 205) It was large, had everything you need including refrig, microwave, and ironing board/iron. Breakfast was great. Beautiful pool. We didn't have a car, and although we stayed 5 nights, we were able to see a great deal as the trolley/bus/train station is only a 5 minute walk from the Old Town Inn. (A car really is needed to see Wild Animal Park, Sea World, and even the Zoo--although we got to the Zoo/Balboa Park by bus without too much trouble.) Old Town itself (5 minute walk) is interesting and fun at night--great places to eat. Would be nice to stay in a place overlooking the ocean, but the room rates would be very high--so we were pleased to find this great motel thru Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GrandpaCalgary
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 13 stay at the Old Town Inn prior to a cruise, the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff very helpful in all respects, nice breakfast. Overall a great place to stay. T. Allen, Calgary, AB.

Reviews.Title: “Another great find thanks to Trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: ttoo
Reviews.Content: As we usually stay at the chain hotels, I wouldn't have considered this hotel except for the mostly positive comments on Trip Advisor. Last year Trip Advisor directed me to a great little place in SF (Castle Inn) and we were so delighted so I decided to "risk" it again and AGAIN we were not disappointed. This place is a great value....free breakfast (with hot waffles!), free parking and central, safe location in a major city for less than $100 per night for a family of four. We came from the Hyatt Grand Champion in Indian Wells the previous nights and thought this property had better beds. Everything was clean and it was the only property in over a week in which we didn't have to ask for extra towels....they were already stocked with enough for four when we arrived. A bit of traffic noise as we were close to the road but nothing that couldn't be blocked out with turning on the air on low in the room and we didn't lose any sleep over it. Walked to Old Town area twice- once at night for dinner and another during day to tour park area and never felt unsafe even with small kids in tow. Lobby innkeeper provided convenient driving directions to all attractions I could think of and many things were accessible within 10-15 min drive without major highways. Trolley and public train station was also within walking distance for those without cars. Sea World discounts adverstised and sold to us though were non-existent as we could have gotten the same rate at the gate but it did save us the time in standing in line at the attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel in calm, yet convenient neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bobomejor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Old Town Inn on a 3-day, 2-night stop in San Diego. We spent a few days at Disneyland, then rented a car, making our way south. The Old Town Inn is conveniently located just a few miles from Sea World and about 10 minutes from the San Diego Zoo. The staff is very nice and helpful; upon checking in, they offered us advice on restaurants and other attractions. The continental breakfast was quite good and the waffle makers that others have mentioned were fun to use. As a non-coffee drinker, I really appreciate that they had hot chocolate packets available (though, I would have loved some herbal tea bags as well!). The breakfast includes cereal, muffins, bagels, toast, orange juice, milk and more. The rooms are quite spacious and very clean. The countertops near the bathroom are made of granite and have plenty of room for your toiletries. Our first night, we ordered pizza from Broadway Pizza, thanks to the recommendations included on a laminated sheet in the room. The pizza was really delicious, a good price and delivered right to our door (no address needed; I just needed to tell them "Old Town Inn" and they said, "OK!). The next night, we drove the few blocks to Old Town. I did some research on Google and found lots of good reviews for the Cafe Coyote and Cantina, located at 2461 San Diego Avenue. We were told the wait would be 20 minutes, but by the time I parked the car and walked a few blocks to the restaurant, my wife already had a table. The service was great, the chips & salsa wer e quite tasty, the hand-made tortillas were great, the portions were generous and the fried ice-cream was delicios. The area gets a bit crowded during the evening, but free parking is available on the street or at the Old Town recreation area on Congress Street between Mason St. & Twiggs St. Just be prepared to pounce as soon as you find a spot during the busy evening hours). I would highly recommend the Old Town Inn for those wishing to see Sea World, the San Diego Zoo and Old Town. The staff is top notch, even if you can't make reservations via their Web site (when I called for a reservation, Beatriz was nice enough to call me back rather put me on hold while she checked in other guests. It was her suggestion that she call me back and I really appreciated it!!). The rooms are large, clean, safe and convenient. Add in the complimentary continental breakfast, complimentary wi-fi, free parking and easy-to-find location, and it's easy to see why the Old Town Inn continues to get rave reviews. '' I'd definitely return next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access”
Reviews.Author: omegam87
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of it's proximity to the airport. Since we were coming in on a late flight I didn't want to have to drive all through San Diego to find our hotel. It was a little difficult at first to find because when you come from the direction of the airport you have to overshoot the hotel (which was easily visible due to the Christmas light wrapped palm trees) then make a quick U turn at the traffic light. It is a quick 5minute walk to Old Town itself and there are pedestrian crossways. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Comfortable beds, clean rooms, adequate breakfast with waffles, etc. We stayed for a few days prior to heading to Maui and again on the way back. The first stay was in a larger room facing the office/pool area and the second stay was in a smaller room (not as nice) away from traffic (yah, that's not possible). That would be my only concern - traffic noise was a real problem for us. I will say it died down a tiny bit in the wee hours - but overall, bring earplugs. We also found a discount coupon in a local hotel guide for this property which we used on our return trip - only good for small room anyway. Cab fare is $15 to/from airport. The service they use charges a flat fee. They were extremely punctual even though we had a last minute change. Parking is easy in and out with no extra charge. The pool looked nice but it was still a little too cold to swim. Overall, good for the price if you just want a reasonably priced home base while exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for those on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: cheerhcs1
Reviews.Content: My friends & I stayed at Old Town Inn March 13 - 19, 2008. We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor & decided to follow the crowd. We were not disappointed! From our warm greetings at our late night check-in, to the staffs eagerness to help us find things to do on the not-so-sunny & warm CA days. The room-203 was typical with 2 queen beds. Enough room for the amount of time we would spend in it. The room was always well cleaned & towels replensihed. When we needed an extra blanket due to the unusually cold weather, they were quick to give us another. The room was very quiet which we really appreciated. The hotel price came with a continental breakfast which included pastries, make-your-own -waffles, fruit, juice, coffee, milk, cereal... The hotel had a nice though small pool which we were not able to enjoy in the low 60 temps. It was clean though & would have been a nice place to take a dip after a long day. Parking is extremely tight as stated in other reviews, so if you have a large vehicle, park on the end. However, we found many places we visited in San Diego, also had tiny parking spaces. Though the hotel is not located in a typical tourist area, it really did not take us more than 20 minutes to get to any beach, or tourist site! It is right across the street from Old Town State Park though, & is right by major freeways. After checking prices for what we needed, this place was fantastic! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: DorothySJ
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the location - we arrived in late afternoon and I was sure our Garmin was wrong ... it was like we were in the middle of an industrial park (Pacific Highway) ... but once we turned into the hotel it was fine. The rooms were great, the lobby and breakfast room were spic & span and very nicely decorated. We stayed at the Old Town Inn for only three nights but wished we could have stayed longer to explore San Diego further. We'll be back! We had a ground floor non-smoking "efficiency" unit which worked out great - we picked up some groceries and had a "real meal" vs. restaurant food. The beds were comfortable, the kitchen was a treat (no more ice in the cooler), I liked the way the vanity (which was huge and offered tons of spreading out space for hair & makeup stuff) and sink were the back of the unit and the tub/shower & toilet were off that again, it seemed to offer a greater degree of privacy. The staff at the front desk (esp. John) were very very friendly and helpful. For some reason, we couldn't connect our laptop (with Evil Vista) to their free wireless, but I was able to use the computer in the lobby to check e-mail. (I could connect to our hotel's wireless service in Anaheim, so I'm not sure if it was caused by Old Town's system, or Evil Vista ...?) Breakfast was slightly above average (it offered waffles in addition to the usual carbohydrates). We were right across the street from the trolley station (we didn't venture to Tijuana, due to lack of time) and we walked around Old Town and ate at the Old Town Mexican Cafe at 2489 San Diego Ave based on John's recommendation - excellent meal, good value. The hotel is also very convenient to the airport. We paid $97/night for the room (booked directly through the hotel) and were very satisified with the overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rlkubi
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 2 other couples in this hotel for a 3 day stay last weekend after a cruise. This hotel is everything that has been stated in the reviews. It's quaint, near Old Town and public transportation, clean, big rooms and friendly staff. We had a wonderful time here and would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone! It was stated it was in an industrial area and near the highway which it was. We did not hear noise from the highway at all and it was a block away from Old Town. It was in a somewhat industrial area but it was safe and we would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, economic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kracmunkie
Reviews.Content: Everyone who's written bad reviews should keep in mind this is a MOTEL, not a luxury resort. You should come in with that level of expectation! We got a standard room with one queen bed for 3 nights. Yes, Old Town Inn is on the outskirts of Old Town. Yes, it's in an industrial area. Yes, it's across the street from the train station and the freeway is audible from most front-facing rooms. But for the price, I can totally live with that. If you're a light sleeper, bring ear plugs, just in case. It's about a $14 cab ride from the airport (a bit pricey, but oh well). There's someone that staffs the front desk 24/7. They provided me with free toiletries like toothbrushes and toothpaste when I realized at past midnight that I forgot to pack the essentials. Also had extra pillows and blankets upon request. They have breakfast 8am to 10am (I think) and it's YUMMY, totally worth waking up for even after a long night. Fresh, hot, self-serve made-to-order Belgian waffles, a variety of danishes, muffins, toast, and bagels. Also there's fresh fruit, canned fruit, OJ, hot coffee and tea. Honestly, for a motel, this is an awesome brekkie. The standard room itself was not bad, fairly small but clean. It fit a dresser, a 27" CRT tv, queen sized bed, and a two-person dining table. There's a vanity, a small walk-in closet, and a bathroom with a standup shower. There's AC & heater in the room just in case the weather isn't perfect. Walls are paper thin so we heard others coughing, talking, and watching tv. This was not nearly as bad as the very occasional train rolling by tooting it ridiculously loud horn. Earplugs are a good thing if you happen to get a room near the street :) We rented a car so I can't really comment on walking distance to everything, but I can say that everything was easy to reach by car. Parking wasn't at all a problem and we came during spring break/St Patricks day weekend. A few oddities: The carpet felt damp the entire time we were there, like they were just shampooed but didn't dry completely. The ventilation of the bathroom wasn't great, drops of water condensed on the ceiling and dropped on our heads (and some of the water was brown). A few lightbulbs were out or close to dead so they would flicker endlessly. I think the previous resident in our room had set the alarm to ring at 7:30 am and didn't turn it off. So, of course, the alarm blared like a siren only after we'd just gotten in 5 hours earlier...SIGH, that was a bad start to an otherwise great trip. Even with these few odd points, I would still recommend this place. I never felt unsafe, was reasonably comfortable and I looked forward to breakfast everyday!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Based on TA reviews, stayed here 5 nights. Couldn't see Hotel sign driving north on Pacific Highway (but well lit coming south). Nice clean NS room, comfy bed, fridge, microwave. Front desk staff very good. Breakfast fine, plenty seats for all. Pool nice but too cool outside for me in Feb to take to the water. Parking safe. Passing train and airplane noise sometimes, but neither would prevent me from staying here again. Trolley station literally over road from the Hotel, but you really need a car to enjoy San Diego. Handy for Hotel Circle shopping district and drive north to La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Location”
Reviews.Author: jbowmansr
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasurful place to stay. The staff was always willing to make your stay more pleasurable. The deluxe continental breakfast is one of the best that I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice...for a Motel”
Reviews.Author: NeaLinda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn based on the reviews here. It was not bad...but also not great. First off, it is NOT in Old Town. It is across a busy street and about a 5 minute walk. It is nestled in an industrial area...not exactly the rustic setting you might imagine. I have to say that they have done as well as possible with landscaping for the area they are in. The rooms are typical motel rooms (not a Hotel or Inn), one window that lets in little outside light. The carpet was ripped and stained, but cleanliness was acceptable. The included breakfast was better than average. Parking spaces are sized for mini-coopers, don't even try to get a mini-van in one. We could never get the promised wireless internet to work. Front desk service and attitude were a plus! Price was good for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Expect to come here again”
Reviews.Author: astronomer-at-large
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week in January. We found the enthusiastic reviews here to be accurate. Good sized room and well appointed (comfortable bed, bath, microwave, fridge, coffee-maker etc.). Good free breakfast. Good location only 3 mins walk to Trolley station, and 10 mins to Old Town restaurants, and good for driving too as easy to get to/from Interstate 5. Wifi in room was unstable as described elsewhere - had to ask for system to be rebooted a couple of times. Main downside is a bit of noise from nearby freeway and rail line, but it didn't seem to keep us awake. We would be happy to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn is a winner for me!”
Reviews.Author: Polly289
Reviews.Content: I have just returned to the UK after two one-night stays at the Old Town Inn. Before I went I looked at their web-site and their price and expected to find a shabby but respectable cheap motel. How wrong I was. It was a great little place! Our rooms were quiet and well appointed, I only had their cheapest room but it was definitely roomy with a fridge and microwave. The breakfast was super and the staff were friendly and exceedingly helpful. The location is superb! It is a mere 2 minute walk to the Old Town with lots of life and good eating places as well as only a one minute walk to the Transit Centre where buses and trolleys go everywhere from La Jolla to Downtown and the border. The Inn is only a 15$ taxi ride away from the airport and so is an excellent base for visitors flying in. The pool area is clean and beautifully planted up with hummingbirds visiting the flowers. I would definitely return and would be happy to use it as a base for a car-less holiday in beautiful San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Motel With Easy Access to Town & Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Perficio
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn @ San Diego is a pleasant little place to stay. Well... It's not that little considering that it has 3 buildings to its name, but it still gives you a cosy and warm feeling. Given that we arrived on Amtrak @ Old Town Station, or rather, the Old Town Platform, the hotel was a short less-than-a-mile walk across the Transit Centre Car Park. Check-in was efficient, and while they did not have the King-Bed Non-Smoking Efficiency Room we had reserved, they upgraded us to a Queen-Bed Smoking one with a full kitchenett. While we really do hate the idea of staying in a smoking room, the hotel really did their very best to deordorize the room and their efforts are not missed. Sadly though, once the heater / air-conditioning is turned on, the smell of smoke came back on full blast. There are no views to speak off at The Old Town Inn, but its proximity to the Old Town transit Centre literally means that you could get to any place in San Diego rather easily. A short 5-minute walk would bring us to the Trolley Station, and from there its a 15-minute ride to Downtown San Diego. Similarly, we could catch a Metro Bus to SeaWorld, which would take all of 20-minutes. The Zoo could also be reached in about 35 minutes. What we loved best is that the hotel has prepared sheets of instructions (driving, public transport, walking, etc) to all the main places of interests from the hotel, so it makes it so much easier for us to simply follow the insturctions and get to where we want to go! The hotel also provides breakfast in a small breakfast room besides the lobby and while simple, was more than adequate to get one going in the mornings. What we loved best was the waffle maker, which if you do know how to operate, would churn out perfect crispy waffles in a matter of minutes! For the reasonable price we paid, we would certainly return to The Old Town Inn should we visit San Diego again as compared to other hotels located Downtown, which could easily cost 2 to 3 times more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ikeymakes3
Reviews.Content: Our stay for 1 night was wonderful. We loved the short walk to Old Town, and the breakfast and welcome bag that was given. Would recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home away from home”
Reviews.Author: budiahqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for ten days in November with two teenagers. We especially loved the breakfast AND kitchen options. The kids LOVED the free Internet! Hotel staff was wonderful and went out of their way to be helpful AND friendly. We found it a great location too, quiet and convenient to everything. Lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: Paulpie
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Old Town Inn. Both stays were for a week. I have traveled extensively and the OTI is by far the nicest hotel I have had the pleasure of staying in ...for the money. Excellent,friendly,professional staff.Very nice clean rooms,great breakfast with waffles,fruit etc for free. All around wonderful place and central location. I will be back again and again! Thanks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at San Diego's Old Town Inn!”
Reviews.Author: lambs2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the night of November 12, 2007 at San Diego's Old Town Inn after a Pacific Coast cruise. We had prebooked the Inn by contacting them through their website after reading a number of positive reviews here on Tripadvisor. The hotel was completely full due to the Veteran's Day weekend. We had a very early disembarkation from the Celebrity Mercury. We rented a car from Thrifty and spent a couple hours seeing the sights - visiting the lovely Del Coronado Hotel on Coronado Island and exploring the Gaslamp District of downtown San Diego. We then drove to the Old Town Inn to check in, but they had had a full house the night before and said to come back in a few hours. We left our car in a parking spot near our room and walked to the historic area of Old Town. Because it was the Veteran's Day holiday we were pleasantly surprised to discover that there were free tours of Old Town Historic park being offered hourly! We were escorted on our tour by four costumed guides portraying known real-life characters from San Diego's early history. One of the park personnel portrayed a gossip-loving female, the wife of an early California governor, who has been immortalized by the letters she left behind showing her proclivity to gossip about fellow citizens and a well documented rivalry with another leading female of Old Town! That day there was also a fellow dressed as an early sherrif, an Irishman who was depicting an early settler and another 19th century young male character. They were all very entertaining and informative, as prior to our day in Old Town we had scant knowlege of California's early history. They each stayed in character for the entire tour and introduced themselves only at the end. Two were park employees and two volunteer reenactors. Old Town is the California equivalent of St. Augustine, a place we live very close to and are well acquainted with in Florida. If you get a chance to see one of these reenactments in Old Town, do so! After our delightful two hour "tour" we browsed through a number of the other historic buildings, did some shopping and then had lunch at the Old Town Mexican Cafe (I am writing a seperate review of this restaurant of which we were not particularly impressed). We then walked back to the Old Town Inn to check into our room and catch a couple hours rest, although we did walk back to Old Town in the early evening to do more browsing. We were very happy with our second floor non-smoking standard room with a queen-sized bed and clean and spacious bath. There was absolutely no noise and we felt that at $69 for the night we got a very good deal. They had coffee available at all times in the office area, as well as a coffee pot and all you needed to make it in the room. They also had free internet usage in the office- I'm not sure about in the rooms as we did not have our laptop on this trip. They also have a lovely clean pool area, free goody bags that included toothpaste, razors, gum and a few other items given to us at the very friendly professional check-in, and an absolutely delightfully clean and well-decorated breakfast area open from 6-10 am that even lets you make your own piping hot waffles! The pastries, cereals, joice and coffee were all very good, as well, and we were completely satisfied with our short stay at the Old Town Inn. I highly recommend this hotel for all travelers. Absolutely great value in a prime location. We asked to stay as far fromthe highway as possible and we heard absolutely no traffic noise whatsoever, nor were disturbed by any of our fellow guests!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: calif0rniam0m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with our kids to spend the weekend in San Diego. We wanted a clean, centrally located place without the hefty price tag. (San Diego hotels are really expensive) Old Town Inn was perfect. We paid about $80 for a room with two queen beds. I really did my research on this one and for the same price could have gotten a real dump in seedy part of town. The hotel is clean and very well kept. The area felt safe. Our room (#206) was pretty roomy, looked and smelled clean, and had (surprisingly) very comfortable beds. An added plus were the two sinks...one in the bathroom and one outside (with large counter space) This really helps when traveling with the kids, The expanded continental breakfast was satisfying. And Patty at the front desk was wonderful...she bent over backwards to make our stay a pleasant one. You can't beat the location...within walking distance of Old Town and the trolley to Gaslamp area and Tijuana. Five minutes to the airport (and rental car agencies)...ten minutes to Balboa Park. The only negative (not a biggy) was that our TV's reception was fuzzy and didn't get all the channels. Oh well. Though it's not a luxury hotel, you don't dread coming back at the end of a long day of sightseeing. Will absolutely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DisneyNutNJ
Reviews.Content: As others have written, we were very happy with our stay at the Old Town Inn. We booked a room with 2 queen beds, the stove and fridge. The staff were very courteous and helpful. We did do the continental breakfast, which was good, with pastries, cereal, hard boiled eggs and coffee - which was perfectly fine by us as we are not big breakfast eaters. We did not try the waffle maker, but it was very popular. The room itself was very clean, plenty of space, and the beds were comfortable. The only complaint my husband had was that the showerhead was very low - it was perfect for me at 5'4", but a little low for my 6 ft husband! Overall, this was perfect for our stay of a few days - clean, comfortable, and close to most attractions. For the approx. $120/night,, it definitely was a great value. I did not need a more expensive hotel where they turn down the sheets and put the mint on the pillow :-). I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed”
Reviews.Author: watermanjr
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we had our doubts but are so happy we stay here. Our visit was 10 days. The hotel seems to be good repair especially the grounds, pool and common areas. Our first room that we had seemed a little small considering we were staying so long so we change to a larger room. They only had a smoking room but we checked it out and there was no odor so we took it. The house keeping wasn't always up to par but only a call to the front desk took care of the problem. The breakfast is very similar to HI Express which was fine. Coffee is available 24 hour/day. Part of our visit was associated with a convention in the city so we had several friends staying at hotel circle. The reports were varied but generally most of them had more complaints about their hotel then we had with ours and we were spending quite a bit less. One of the best parts of our stay was the fact the trolley/bus station is just down the street. We did not rent a vehicle until we decided travel for a few days outside of San Diego. Old Town is a short walk and we felt very safe even coming back after dinner in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn”
Reviews.Author: beachlover034
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the beginning of October. It is a very well maintained property, shows pride in ownership. The rooms are comfortable, the pool area is clean and attractive. It is convenient to the trolley and bus so there is no need to drive your car to area attractions and pay high parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: Ramblerose
Reviews.Content: A friend and I took the Pacific Surfliner from Glendale, Ca to Old Town Station in San Diego and needed a hotel within walking distance. Took the advice of a Tripadvisor commenter and booked the Old Town Inn. It is an older motel type 3 blocks from the train station and close to the Old Town restaurants. Very friendly staff. The room had 2 queen beds, a comfortable upholstered chair, desk with 2 chairs, plenty of lights to read by. There was a sink and very long counter space outside the bathroom and another sink in the room with the shower & toilet . Complimentary breakfast included waffles, cereal, bagels, sweet rolls and fruit. Place was clean and well maintained. Room rate was approx $96 Saturday night and $86 Sun night. Nitpicky stuff was the untensils were cheesy plastic and there was no hook in bathroom door. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of paradiseclose to all the action”
Reviews.Author: DocIslands
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Town Inn, Old Town, San Diego, CA 10/03 to 10/09/07. What a truly magnificent Inn! Tucked away adjacent to the Old Town transportation center's parking lot on Pacific Highway, it has all of the amenities of a much bigger hotel group and all the comforts of being cozily accessible without being overwhelming. Their freindliness started from check-in, thru check out and included calling a cab for my airport return home - way to go!! Their breakfasts include make-your-own waffles, fresh muffins and pastries( I saw the box containing same, delivered), 3 types of cold cereal, 3 types of oatmeal, juice, fresh-made and sustained coffee, bagels, hardboiled eggs and fresh milk. The room I had was excellently oversized and well-maintained by room attendant; the pool, while not Olympic-size, was sufficient to get wet and relax and get some of that famed southern California sun! The flowers around the pool and property were in excellent condition and well maintained. In short: I would and will go back and absorb some of their hopitality and genuine friendliness. You could pay a lot more and not get nearly the value,comfortliness and accessability of this Outstanding INN!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: BeginnerTraveller
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I recently stayed at the Old Town Inn for a week while vacationing in San Diego. We thought it was a great place to stay, especially with the low prices. The rooms were clean & quiet, the staff were always very friendly, and the location was great. We chose to take public transit, rather than rent a car; and there was both a trolley station and major bus link just down the block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dirtyd12
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Old Town Inn from Thursday through Monday in late September, 2nd floor, king size bed deluxe room. We paid on average $105/night. Bed was VERY comfy and room was clean, no smells, no noise problems. Great location to everything...right on the major highways going anywhere in SD and a short walk to Old Town. The breakfast was a nice touch, waffles and cereal were good. They helped us get San Diego Zoo tickets cheaper than the gate price. Very friendly staff also. The hotel/motel is just that. A cheaper alternative to staying in a marriott or hilton or holiday inn, basically the same accomodations without the name. It's not going to blow you away as the best place you've ever stayed but it's a nice, cheaper alternative. Reminded me of a nicer version of a quality inn. Most important things to us was that it was clean, the bed was comfortable (surprisingly comfy actually) and that it was cheap. And the staff was very friendly and willing to help which was a bonus. I'd definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: vaccaritzo2
Reviews.Content: I found the Old Town Inn to be fantastic in every way. The hotel was clean and the staff anticipated our every need all being done at prices that were beyond reasonable. The complimentary breakfast was a feast, so much that lunch seemed unnecessary. Four stars and our thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: hesperiapawn
Reviews.Content: Great people who run the Old Town Inn. We needed to stay an extra nite and they made it possible. We will be staying there again and again and again 5 Stars!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thanks from the folks who had a marine getting out of boot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Unusual Location”
Reviews.Author: CathySEdmondsWA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite comfortable and in a convenient location - particularly for those who want to travel without renting a car. Prepare yourself that it's immediate surroundings are industrial buildings - not other hotels and restaurants. However, Old Town's restaurants and tourist attractions are an easy walk away (you might not feel as comfortable walking after dark). The Old Town Transit Center connects you to trolleys, buses and commuter rail. A cab to the airport was $14 (w/out tip). The front desk staff were extremely helpful in giving us directions to sites we wanted to visit. Plenty of options for breakfast at the hotel's buffet. Pool was pleasant. Would definitely consider a stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: ristacat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, plus two teenagers stayed for our vacation to Sea World and the Animal Park. Everyone enjoyed this one very much. The hotel beds were very comfortable. The pool is really nice and relaxing area. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. They had waffle makers, muffins, cereal, and lots more. Yes, the room did have a little bit of odor from the chemical cleaners, but when we turned on the AC, it didn't seem to be a problem. It is just a walk, and a skip to Old Town San Diego it was really fun to see the night scene and eat at an authentic Mexican restaurant. The hotel staff was very nice and knowledgeable. Sea World is really close. Parking is a little tight. Overall the stay was very enjoyable, the rates were excellent and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff..Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: maryluehoo
Reviews.Content: I just happened to find the Old Town Inn On a yahoo website..Then decided to call to ask about the hotel..The reservationist was a delight, but I was still undecided. So she told me it would be a good idea to check them out on tripadvisor! I did and I booked my room!! I couln't be happier for the price range and cleanliness! Not to mention the front desk staff! They were all so helpful! Especially Mary (Iremember because we share the same name and she made a silly comment about it) I think the other woman was Ann or Anna..Both very sweet with a wonderful sense of humor! I could have stayed the whole night in the lobby if they would have been there! All in all the rooms were very clean and even the housekeepers were sweet.. In fact they were so honest that I left a tip one of the days I was there and they didn't take it! I had to put it in an envlope that said housekeeping on it! The breakfast was delicious and fairly large..Plus I got to chit chat with the wonderful ladies at the front desk some more! I have to say this is by far one of the best places I have stayed at! Thank you Old Town Inn if a wonderful and forever memorable trip to San Diego! I will deffinately reccomend you to everyone I know!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing given favourable reviews”
Reviews.Author: Dfenz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site as we wanted to be somewhere near Old Town. However, we rather disappointed with the hotel. The room itself, while clean, was no more than adequate. We had difficulty finding a carpark space near the room with some large vehicles in particular making it very awkward to park in certain places. The air conditioning was rather noisy. The main reason for choosing this hotel was its location near old town. I had a bit of difficulty finding the hotel in the first place but when I did I was surprised to find it in a somewhat industrial area and the nearby neighbourhood didn't look the best in the world. In fact whoever decided to call the hotel the Old town inn deserves royalties because I'm sure the name gets people interested in the hotel as an old town accommodation spot. On a map the hotel looks very near old town which technically it is. But to get there, even if it only takes 5 minutes, you have to walk past a warehouse, cross a busy highway, walk under a freeway and then an underpass under some railway tracks and a trolley station (the trolley goes all the way to Mexico border from here). Not really a walk for those with a nervous disposition although once in old town everything seemed safe enough. In a nutshell I'd prefer a few more touristy things adjacent to the hotel to make the walk more pleasant. Being on the highway has one advantage. Its an easy 5 minute drive to SeaWorld if that's what you're in San Diego for. As someone who has visited most other parks in Southern California I thought that park was a little too commercialised for my liking with not enough rides or indeed shade to keep the little ones happy. The inclusive breakfast was fine although on both mornings there were shortages of various items. Seating, especially for families was also in short supply at times. Reception was reasonably efficient and there was a handy driving guide available to get to various places from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It !!”
Reviews.Author: americanretrocarmen
Reviews.Content: Me and my family decided to share a room, we found a family suite that slept 6 at the old town inn. The room is located on the 2nd floor, in the new part of the hotel. The room was a very nice..yeah it smelled a bit funky but , what do you expect when people would rather use the ac then open window. We left the door open for about 5 min while we got everyone and everything out of the car., and the smell was gone. The family suite had the following: Sofa that turns in to a bed, ( i had read in previous reviews that the sofa beds was hard to sleep on so we decided to pack a thick comforter to add to the top, and it worked great) it had a tv, table, fridge w/freezer, micro, stove, sink,. It had to french doors that opened up to 2 queen beds (oh the matresses ..felt really nice I have a bad back so it was nice to sleep good ) another tv and a closet. The restroom was really clean, pleanty of space as well as the sink and vanity. we had a iron ironing board and oh extra pillows ... which by the way i wanted to bring home, they felt really nice , reallly expensive. the pool was great for the kids , it was warm so a night swim was great. The free breakfast had alittle for veryone :) I cant say enough about the staff... we for sure will visit again..if possible the same suite :)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CathyFrance
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel in Old Town several months ago, after reading all the rave reviews about Old Town Inn I decided to contact them. I exchanged several emails with their very friendly and helpful reservations staff and based on that exchange, reserved a deluxe room for 2 nights. In my emails to the staff, I had explained that since my friend and I were travelling from Paris, we would be jetlagged and wanting a *quiet* room. I was assured that if we went with a deluxe room, we would get a quiet room. Also, I informed the staff that we would be arriving late, around 10 pm, and was told that was not a problem. When we arrived (slightly earlier than expected, but after travelling for almost 24 hours) the only "deluxe" room left was on the ground floor on the parking lot (114). However, on my key-car envelope, it was clearly marked that we were supposed to be on the 3rd floor in room 313. We went back to the desk where the very friendly receptionist explained that the hotel was booked and that our ground floor room was the only one left. So, despite my numerous emails in advance and the key card written out in my name with a 3rd floor room assignment, we were stuck with leftovers. I have heavy-duty ear plugs, so I thought it would be ok. At 6:15 am this morning, the herd of elephants in the room above us woke us up, apparently preparing for the circus. Despite my heavy-duty ear plugs, I could also hear cars in the parking lot. After unsuccessfully trying to go back to sleep (ah, jetlag!) I decided to take a swim in the heated pool for some exercise and relaxation. I got to the pool at 6:45 am. Locked. I went inside t o reception to see if someone could open it, and the receptionist (different from our arrival) refused. I explained that I had been woken up, was jetlagged, and just wanted to swim some laps and not make any noise, but je refused, saying no, the pool doesn't open until 7 am. However, there were about 4 people eating breakfast in the breakfast room, whereas allegedly breakfast doesn't start until 7 am either... So now I am back in the "deluxe" room, which I purposely put in quotes because it's barely big enough to fit the 2 beds (which are, however, very comfortable). Luckily, the WiFi is working fine. While the reservations staff was friendly, as was the person who welcomed us last night, I do not feel that friendliness makes up for misleading me about getting a quiet room (everyone knows that a ground floor room is never the quietest!!!) and for this morning's unfriendliness and lack of know-how of when to make an exception (btw, the pool hours are *not* posted at the pool.) Thus, I cannot recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Still Like it”
Reviews.Author: imacmom
Reviews.Content: Second time at this hotel this year--winter and summer. So we've experienced a difference in seasonal pricing of course, but still plenty satisfied with accommodations and service. They are so nice and it's really clean and close to everything you want better in all respects than Hotel Circle offerings, and we've had that experience once and that was enough. Family friendly and a really well-cared for pool. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bug bites”
Reviews.Author: 2007californiateach
Reviews.Content: On my first night, I woke up with spider bites all down one arm. When I informed the front desk that I needed another room as I was staying in town for 5 days, he said I needed to wait for the manager. I had to switch all my stuff into a new room - ooh, and I got one night free after complaining up the chain of command. I got really sick a few days later. It's on a really busy highway across from a factory or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: natinmd
Reviews.Content: I had to split my stay in San Diego between hotels, the Old town Inn was the second hotel I stayed at. It is clean, somewhat older (I stayed in the back), I would definitely stay there again. It is positioned in an excellent place for sighseeing. Literally it is a 10 minute drive from the airport and all points downtown San Diego (Seaport Village, Gaslamp, etc). 15-20 minutes from Balboa park and the San Diego zoo. If you want to jump on I-8 you have the beaches and beautiful scenery. Oh yeah Old Town San Diego is right across the street! It is a great place to stay for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room & Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: pinkhorse
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly after finding it on tripadvisor. I wanted a basic room to crash for a night and this place was perfect. I picked the Economy Standard Room, which is in the older part of the hotel. It was about $78 bucks, which is such a bargain in San Diego. Most places I looked into wanted to charge double that amount! I was very pleased with the room, which was a good size and super clean. There was a TV, Phone, LOTS of towels, and the bed was comfortable. There was no tub, only a stand up shower, but who wants to take a bath where thousands of folks have been anyway?? I found out that there is a free breakfast and Old Town is just blocks away. I had to catch a 6 am flight so I didn't have the continental breakfast. Heck! For the price, the breakfast is a bonus! The location is great (close to Old Town and it's about 10 minutes away from the airport.) When checking in, I noticed you can buy Sea World and Legoland tix at a reduced price from the Inn...so this will be a great deal for families. There is also a pool. A couple of negatives: you can hear people outside talking as they walked to their cars. Since it is on Pacific Highway, you'll hear an occasional big rig rumbling by. Otherwise, it's a great deal, friendly check-in service, awesome find, thanks Tripadvisor! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, good staff, and new furniture time warped in from 1984”
Reviews.Author: 2RInsider
Reviews.Content: This is a nice family run hotel in a great location. The rooms are bigger than most in town--I stay in a different SD hotel every three weeks. They're well lit, clean, comfortable, and quiet. It's the best "mid-budget" deal in town. (If you need "low-budget" try the Good Nite Inn Sea World.) The only weird thing is the pastel/floral print decor. It's all clean and pristine, as if it had been time warped in fresh from 1984. I don't know where they get the stuff, but it's all new and well maintained. If you're nostalgic for the days of Blondie and Reagan, this is paradise. If you're looking for a good room at a good price, support some great people and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: ggardengirl1
Reviews.Content: Wow! We were pleasantly surprised at this quaint motel! We stayed for 4 nights in an economy room and it was wonderful for the price! The room was cleaned to perfection every day when we returned and the continental breakfast was great! Not like the usual coffee and breakfast roll. They had many things to choose from and a room to sit down and eat. The grounds were kept VERY clean, and the best part is that it's in close walking distance to the downtown trolley and buses! So you can just leave your car in the motel parking lot and take the trolley everywhere. And historic Old Town San Diego is also right there to enjoy! This is by far the best economy priced room we've ever stayed in! We would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another happy customer!”
Reviews.Author: jsundy29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in June and was completely satisfied. We were arriving on a later flight and Old Town was a short drive from the airport. Our room was extremely clean and spacious. The AAA rate for a Friday night could not be beat. The breakfast area was quaint and there was a decent selection of items. I chose this Inn based on all the positive feedback right here at trip advisor. I was not disappointed. I'd go back in a heartbeat and recommend this place to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: katie1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a pretty exterior and the inside is also nice, very comfortable, with standard motel-type rooms. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is parking available right outside the rooms. The breakfast was lovely, with all the usual continental breakfast options as well as waffle-making facilities! The price was reasonable too.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job very nice”
Reviews.Author: Luckydog23
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Inn,was really nice. The rooms were small but did the job for the price, everything was nice just one problem room had a smell to it but went away after u let door open for a bit ,they need air freshners in them . But all in all was a nice stay for the price and morning breakfast was good for free. will stay again next trip

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: JayCa
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in a AAA magazine, check the reviews here and recommended it to my inlaws for a week long stay of thiers. We originally were only going to join them for one night but last minute we were able to make it two. My mother inlaw made the reservations directly with the property. We realized we could make it a night earlier so we called the day before the night we wanted to now arrive. It was a Friday or Saturday night so we crossed our fingers hoping they had availability...and they did, just barely. It was a good thing we called when we did. We arrived before the parents and checked in at the same time 2 seperate people came in asking for any room, they were completely booked! The rooms are very plain and a little old but clean. The first room we were in the first night was a little noisy from the street traffic but then the pouring rain came and drowned out the noise (no pun intended). Our second night's room just below the other was a little smaller (one bed vs. two) and surprisingly a little quieter. My husband's parents room was a deluxe with a fridge, microwave little table and more. It seemed almost smaller than our rooms but it had more in it and only one bed. THey loved it! Thier room was off the street, quiet and close to the pool. Their pool is very nice, heated and a pleasant place to relax after a busy day out and about. The breakfast included was fantastic, probably the best thing about the place. It is a buffet and has (drumroll please)......a waffle making station! Make your own waffles, all you can eat. They put out the batter and you cook 'em. There is also your standard fruit, muffins, bagels, dry cereal, OJ and tea and coffee and hot cocoa are available 24hours in the breakfast room. We never went to Old Town when we were there but it is very easy to get to from what I understand. Balboa park was a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Thepeevs
Reviews.Content: Our positive experience started when we called the hotel to book our stay. The person who answered the phone was so pleasant and helpful. Not being from the area we had lots of questions and they answered everyone of them. We read of all the reviews but were still a little hesitant due to the low price but we were not dissappointed. Rooms are comfortable. My sister loved the efficiency and so did we (used her microwave and fridge). Pool area was great, loved the breakfast, waffles are delicious. I can't say enough about the front desk staff. They went out of their way to give us directions, suggestions for restaurants, and even made a phone call for us to find out local church service times. My only complaint would have to be the maids, they don't speak English so our room was not cleaned a few days because of confusions due to the language barrier. People complain about the noise but we just kept the fan on in our room and you couldn't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price !!!”
Reviews.Author: LucyFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn for a week in June. It is an excellent hotel. Great location : - Walking distance from Old Town (Good restaurants and shops) - Close to all main attractions (SeaWorld, Zoo, Beaches, ...) and downtown San Diego. - Even if the hotel is near the highway, we did not hear a noise. Great price and service : - Around 100 $ (AAA price) for a large room with 2 queen beds (wich are very very comfortable) and a kitchnette. - Good breakfast included (waffles, bagels, cereals, ...) - The service was excellent and very friendly. If the Old Town Inn would just upgrade their amenities like the soap bars and shampoo and add some shower caps, it would be comparable to a Hampton Inn wich is more expensive. We had an excellent stay and would definitively stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “best buget place in san diego!”
Reviews.Author: candegurrl25
Reviews.Content: this place was great. The staff was helpful. The old town is across the street. The pool was nice. Breakfast is okay.(it was free who cares!) Will always stay here when i go to san diego!rooms are simple but for the price you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jleighs
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD Location is right across the street from the trolley and not much further than that to restaurants (Casa Guadalajara was especially good) and shopping area. Deluxe Efficiency room is quite large and gave my 1-year old a lot of room to play. Has an adequate kitchenette. Staff was friendly and informative. Allowed us to check-in 2 hours early. Very clean. No pests in the room. Breakfast consisted of waffles that you made yourself on an iron, pastries, juice, coffee, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, etc. It was in a separate room off the lobby and had a dining area. We paid $121 for a Saturday night during the SD Rock & Roll Marathon. $109 for the following Sunday. We were very pleased with the price and the inn was right on the marathon route. THE BAD Sofa bed was completely broken. I tried to sit down on it and the bottom half of the mattress fell through the springs. The pipes were ridiculously loud. I am not a light sleeper but I was woken up and could not fall back to sleep until the person above us had finished their shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JohansenRJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Town Inn on May 20 when I needed to be in San Diego overnight and didn't wanna freeload on friends. I previously lived in San Diego for 8 years and know the city quite well, and had passed by the Old Town Inn many times without taking note of it. My experience mirrored most of those reviewed on here. The property was very clean and well maintained. I also stayed in the older section, which I thought was perfectly adequate and reasonably priced. Although the Inn is located in a semi industrial area, it actually is very short drive to a large shopping area slightly to the west and north with plenty of sit down and fast food restaurants, drug stores, a supermarket, Target, Starbucks, Jamba Juice, etc. It's a very good location for access to the downtown area and shelter island waterfront areas, more convenient than Mission Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice in expensive San Diego”
Reviews.Author: OldGal&Todd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading positive reviews and in general were quite pleased. We liked the older section with its minute room and shower, sort of had a 40s-50s vibe about it, and we asked for a room away from the highway so did not have issues with noise as some reviewers claimed. Top marks go to the always cheerful and cooperative staff; in fact, the owner should give them raises. Whatever they are making, it is not enough...their attitudes distinguish this motel from others in the same price range. Most impressive was the incredible cleanliness of everything, and it was obvious the cleaning staff took great pride in their work. Would make a few minor suggestions to the (responsive) owners, to upgrade the plain bar of soap and shampoo to a slightly higher brand, and to have the breakfast makers pay a little closer attention to the supply of food and utensils during the breakfast hours, perhaps checking every 10-15 minutes. But all in all, a good choice for budget accomodations in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: iluvmrkitty
Reviews.Content: We might be 'hotel snobs' , but we truly appreciate cleanliness and service. This hotel went above and beyond in both. Our rooms were very comfortable. The hotel was quiet, even on a sold-out Cinco de Mayo weekend. The location was perfect for visits to Old Town, Sea World and the zoo. We absolutely loved our time spent lounging by the pool and marveled at the lovely landscaping and clean surroundings. The breakfast was a big hit, and we had 4 highly discriminating teenagers with us! Great variety and freshness...also loved the waffles and hard-boiled eggs. Every staff person we encountered went out of their way to show us hospitality and friendliness. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: vtflyer1
Reviews.Content: Pros -Reasonable rates, close to Old Town, decent location for home base if you rent a car. Cons - Terrible traffic noise, the 'Expanded Continental Breakfast' was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: daveincarolina
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery (because of the low price), but all I needed was a hotel for 1 night before an early morning flight. I was very pleasantly surprised at the immaculate room and pleasant help at the front desk. Free wireless internet, comfortable bed, and all for about 1/2 what I would pay for the same thing at a name hotel. I stayed in the newer section, so can't comment on the older rooms, but I had a great stay. Unfortunately, I had to leave early in the morning so I didn't get a chance to sample the breakfast, but the breakfast room was large, well laid-out, and very clean (like the rest of the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Puttin' On The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: OldFolkie
Reviews.Content: I'd like to give a poor review of this place so I'll have no problem getting a reservation the next time we visit. But, I can't. This is a wonderful motel and a great value! We stayed in the older section of the motel. The rooms are a bit Spartan but very clean, good water pressure in the shower and plenty of hot water. We get a room to sleep in, not as a place to spend our vacation time. The bed? Well, six months earlier we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in St. Louis at $250ºº a night in a room with all the amenities (including some we didn't know existed) and the bed at the Old Town Inn was more comfortable. This is no exaggeration by any means. The complimentary breakfast was all we needed. Cereal, toast, milk/juice/coffee, hard-boiled eggs and the now legendary waffle machine. We traveled in Scandinavia a year ago and got a bit spoiled as far as breakfasts go but The Old Town had one of the best , if not the best, complimentary breakfasts we've had in the US. The staff? Friendly - wonderful and helpful. We needed a few little things and they took care of us in record time. It's right off Pacific Highway. That may seem a detriment to some but we didn't hear any traffic noise at all. We loved the fact that it was a straight shot to and from the car rental which made it much easier on us when it came time to get back to the airport. Also, it was a joy to pull out of the lot and be on our way for our day trips. To me, the location was a plus. All in all I'd say this place deserves my five stars and I will definitely stay here again on all my return visits to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: teressa46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the end of March 2007. It is a great place for the price. Very clean, property is clean and neat, pretty flowers. Had a good continental breakfast, nice breakfast room. Parking is a little tight, but for the price you can't beat it. Easy to get to local attractions, old town, beaches, sea world.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value, but...”
Reviews.Author: KY_EnviroGuy
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 2-night stay at the Old Town Inn. The room and service were both above average, and the continental breakfast was fairly good for the price. The main warning I have is to make sure that you are staying in the NEWER part of the hotel. A friend of ours stayed in the older part while we were there, and his room was of marginal quality. There was a big difference between our room and his room. It's worth the extra cost of staying in the newer rooms. For the price, it's a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: 1kcmogirl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. I stayed here with my 11 year old son, 15 year old daughter and 16 year old niece. We were all pleased with it. It was more than sufficient for us since we were only there in the evenings and to sleep anyway. We stayed for 3 nights in a deluxe standard room on the 3rd floor. It was a clean room with 2 queen size beds, a coffee maker, iron, ironing board and hair dryer. They only had smoking rooms available which ended up being no problem for us because it didn’t even smell like smoke in the room. We were pleasantly surprised when we showed up around 10:00 a.m. because our room was ready! We were able to check in and drop off all our belongings before heading out for the day. The staff was friendly and helpful, which I think is very important. They recommended a pizza place that delivered that first night because we just wanted to eat in and hang out at the pool. It was actually pretty good! The pool seemed kind of small and was suppose to be heated. However, everyone was complaining about how cold the water was. They did have towels set out for you so you don’t even have to ask for them. They also have a computer for guests to use, with a 15 minute limit. That was definitely nice to be able to check our e-mails and/or do some research about the area. The breakfast was fine but the OJ was watered down since they put ice in it. They didn’t always keep up with re-filling the bagels & muffins either. The waffles were great though. Another issue is that they only have 8 tables in the breakfast room which wasn’t always sufficient seating for everyone. The location was great because we were able to walk to Old Town for shopping and dinner, Sports Arena for In & Out Burgers and Starbucks, to the MCRD to watch the Marine graduation, and to the transit center to take the bus and/or trolley – which we took to SeaWorld and Coronado Island without any problems. The day we left, we checked out of our room, stored our luggage with them for the day and then they called a cab for us once we were ready to go to the airport. They even called a place that the fare was only $10 something without tip! Overall, for about $104/night with tax for 4 people, it was worth it.!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Famiilytrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-March and rented a total of 4 rooms for our extended family. The inn is clean, well-run, and a great value. We stayed in the newer section of the inn and the rooms were more than adequate. Our room had a refrigerator and microwave, although the rooms with 2 double beds did not-probably because there was less space there. A small inconvenience. We stayed a total of six nights and found the front desk people helpful and pleasant. The location is convenient although not in the fanciest section of town. The inn was fully booked on several of the nights and the parking lot and breakfast room do get crowded, but no real problem-we took our breakfast around the pool one day. Any complaints about the breakfast were made by nit-pickers; the food is plentiful and more than adequate. We will definitely stay here again. Tip: Have dinner at the Old Venice Cafe and Restaurant-great food-be sure to get a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bigelowfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn for one night prior to going to the airport the next morning. We just needed a basic, clean place to crash for a few hours. The hotel room was just that - very basic - but the price was right. We wouldn't recommend this hotel for a long stay, but for one night it was just fine. The pool was small but fine. It was a really windy day so there were some leaves and other tree stuff in the water but it wasn't the hotel's fault. The room had a weird cleaning product smell but we just opened the window for a while and then it was OK. It's right across the street from Old Town which is why we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay strictly for economy, not for comfort”
Reviews.Author: redlucy599
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Town Inn on March 22-March 23, 2007. I found the staff to be polite, and the rooms to be clean. There are no in-room amenities aside from a small bar of soap, and a small shampoo (bring your blow dryer and if you are looking for coffee forget it). There are two sides to the Inn (one appears to have been renovated recently) and my room was located on the older side. It was a business trip and was located near Old Town and within walking distance of Taylor Street where I needed to be the following morning. The Inn is poorly located on the very busy Pacific Highway, and there is nothing to look at except for the I-8 Freeway overpass, the rail & bus transit center located directly underneath the overpass of I-8, and a very large Warehouse type building (Naval & Space Warship Facility of some sort) directly across the street. Very noisy area, thin walls and strange configuration from the lobby to the older part of the Inn (two different driveways, very confusing). Cable TV was horrible (didn't come in very well), but the Continental Breakfast was satisfactory. Stay here only if you are looking to save on cash. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the low-price - hotel is under construction - very old.”
Reviews.Author: travelphotog
Reviews.Content: The hotel was definitely not worth the low price we paid ($75 per night for the cheapest room after taxes). The rooms surrounding us were under renovation so there was constant pounding and tearing noises during the day. The room was uncomfortably-small and fairly old. The bathroom fan was not working correctly and was extremely loud. Several of the interior lights did not function. We asked for extra pillows and blankets and did not get any. I finally went down to the office to get some and all they had was one ripped blanket. The walls were very thin and we could easily hear the people below us coughing all night. Also, it seemed like there were people living there on a permanent basis as there were a couple of very large 4x4 trucks that would come in and out at all hours of the night with music blaring. We didn't realize check-out time was 11:00 and literally got kicked-out at 11:45 by the maid who explained we had to pay an extra day if we stayed any longer. It was a terrible experience and it we would have happily paid twice the price for a decent hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, staff and location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travegmommy
Reviews.Content: After searching the internet for a couple weeks, I finally decided to book a night here for our trip to sea world. I could'nt believe how extremely close we were. I have to admit when we got off the freeway we were a little nervous on what to expect but to our surprise the hotel looked beautifully landscaped, clean and as we walked into the front desk it was as cozy as can be . We especially loved the breakfast the next morning. The only thing I have to reccomend is to stay on a top floor because of the thin walls and be prepared to have the smell of cigarrettes in your non-smoking room. Who knows maybe youll have better luck than i did.I was told it was problably someone from the night before. After all this i will most likey come back. My kids loved the night swimming and the central location of this hotel. Can't beat the price too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum-From-OH
Reviews.Content: We loved The Old Town-Inn. It was very clean, convenient to everything, very affordable and the staff was very friendly. They even have a computer with Internet in the lobby to use which was convenient to look up directions or to book reservations for tours, etc. The breakfast was great which really saved us quite a bit of money by eating there everyday. The beds were really comfortable and the pillows were fluffy. If you are wanting a CLEAN motel at a very affordable price, this is the place. When I originally made my reservations they did not have a room for our entire stay. They were full on one night of the last weekend we were to be there so I booked it until that last weekend of our stay and had backup reservations somewhere else for the remainder of our stay. We checked in and stayed for a few days, then went to LA for a couple of days and when we came back and checked in they had a cancellation and we were able to stay there for the remainder of our stay. We were so glad!!! If I were to go back to San Diego I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: TT40
Reviews.Content: While the price was certainly right ($65) I think I would recommend something a little more upscale if it's in your budget. We stayed for a few nights and here were our findings: Great price, very clean with friendly efficient staff and a workstation with free internet access in the lobby. Overall the property was very well taken care of. On the downside, our room was very small (even for just one parent and one kid) and while we didn't hear traffic (even though it is located on a 'highway'), we could pretty much hear conversation and noise from rooms next door. Overall, it was alright but I think we'd stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, affordable, free internet!”
Reviews.Author: shanews
Reviews.Content: PROS: great staff, great service, free breakfast and coffee throughout the day, free internet in lobby with printer, great central location, clean room, cable tv, microwave, small fridge, etc. CONS: thin walls (especially if you're on the bottom floor). I recommend this place, but do get a top floor room if people making noise above you will annoy you.

Reviews.Title: “Suited Us Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: escondido
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, small hotel close to the Sports Arena, as we were in San Diego for one night only for a concert there.
