The bath was clean as a whistle with a wall that separated the main room from the bath. Also, the shower/flush is separate, so someone can be in the shower while another is getting ready at the sink. Pool is nice and very clean. Five minutes (about) from the airport. Lots of literature on local attractions. Staff are willing to give you information on local area. Liquor store just behind hotel (5 minute walk) Restaurants are across the street (Historic Old Town) Wonderful stay. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: MarikoH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn from July 21st through 25th, 2005, in room 106. The room was a typical room (clean) with two queen beds, table with a chair, an outer vanity area with a sink and a small coffee maker. Inside the bathroom was an additional sink that came in very handy. The hotel landscaping is very pretty (lots of greenery with flowers) and the heated pool is very sparkling (it would be nice if they had a hot tub). After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, we thought the breakfast was going to be extraordinary but it was just satisfactory. There were two waffle makers, cereals, danishes, muffins, toast or bagels, fruit (bowl of canned fruit and apples), coffee/hot tea/hot chocolate, boiled eggs, and orange juice. The dining area can be very crowded on the weekends but during the week wasn't bad. The hotel is comparable to La Quinta or Comfort Inn and is very conveniently located to all the sights. The staff is very kind and informative and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the 'Gem' we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seeing the Old Town Inn rated as the 10th best hotel in San Diego, and reading all the glowing reviews here, we obviously thought we had uncovered a hidden gem. Trip Advisor has always been reliable for us, but definately not this time. To begin with, the hotel is not really in Old Town. It is located on an industrial road about a mile from the historic district. You can walk to the historic Old Town area, but you have to walk along Pacific Hwy for a bit, then cross under the freeway and past the train station to get to it. No way would I take my family along this route after dark. The room was old and had a musty smell. The furniture looked like it was from the 1970's. We were awoken both mornings at 5am by the garbage truck behind the hotel. To make matters worse, someone's dog starting barking out in the hallway at 7am and this went on for 30 minutes both mornings. The breakfast that everyone raves about is nothing more than a waffle maker, donuts, muffins, cereal, and yogurt. Of course the breakfast area is so small that it was always difficult to find somewhere to sit, especially if you have more than 2 people in your group. I took a quick peek at the pool which was very small like you would find at any budget motel. Parking is tight, we couldn't find a space when we first arrived late at night. Each space is very narrow, and pretty difficult to get in and out of the car when you can barely open the car door. The final straw was having to kill a cockroach in the bathroom in the middle of the night. I've never checked out of a hotel earlier than planned in my life, but we did that next morning. Yes, the front desk staff are friendly, and it's a convenient location for getting to Sea World and Old Town(by car), but it should be clarified that the Old Town Inn is simply a 1 star budget motel. You'll save some money staying here but it was not worth it. I can only conclude that all these glowing reviews are either fabricated by the owners of the motel, or the people submitting there opinions are comparing the place to a Motel 6 or Super 8. Giving it 5 stars is ridiculous. What would they give the Hotel del Coronado? We stayed our final night at the Courtyard San Diego Central for only $30 more a night. The place was great. We were definately penny wise and pound foolish on this one.

Reviews.Title: “What a Treasure”
Reviews.Author: ourladyofrevlon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in dozens of hotels-motels in San Diego over the last 30 years as I live just 2 hours away. We booked this by all the great reviews on this site. We hesitantly booked the economy room for $71. When we got there the staff was awesome. I told them my concerns on the economy & they gave me a key to look at 1st saying they want me to be thoroughly happy with my stay. Well, the room is small & a ways from the main area. Not bad by any means but I asked to see a little nicer & larger room. We looked at room 204 & were delighted. The front desk clerk, Sarah charged us only $15 more & let me tell you it was well worth it. A king size bed, sofa & coffee table, microwave, refrigerator, iron & board, coffee table, table w/2 chairs, large screen TV with HBO. Bathroom had tub/shower & outside the bath is a very large sink area with tons of rooms to put all my makeup & hair access. The pool area is lovely w/beautiful flowers. The deluxe continental breakfast was great. I have read people not so pleased with it but if you want a cooked to order breakfast stay at Embassy Suites for $200 +. The breakfast consisted of 2 waffle makers with the batter poured in individual cups, many hot & cold cereals, bagels, sweet rolls & toast, cream cheese & jams, apples & oranges, fruit cocktail, hard boiled eggs, juice & coffee, tea & cocoa. FREE! A small observance that I was impressed with is that their vending machine sodas were only 75 cents. The whole place was immaculate & staff personnel genuinely warm & caring. A special thanks to Doug at the front desk also who was so much fun to talk to. This will be my motel of choice for my future trips. If you have any questions on good shopping & eating in San Diego please feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Not terribly impressed with The Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Old Town Inn on 7-7th for a one night stay. I was extremely excited to stay there after reading all the fabulous reviews here on Tripadvisor. All the reviews I read praised David as being a wonderful host. When we checked in David was helping another guest on the phone and seemed to be going out of his way to help this person searching for a vacant hotel-(they were booked) going as far as looking up phone numbers for this wayward traveler. What great customer service! Unfortunately as David was busy we were checked in by Sarah who has a lot to learn from David it seems, she was curt, short and never offered so much as a smile or a welcome. The room being a non smoking room smelled musty and old, sheets came off both beds throughout the night, they don't seem to fit the pillowtop mattresses as they should. I would reccommend this hotel for someone not looking for anything special just a clean place to sleep at night. I was extremely disappointed as I expected a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “This inn is great!”
Reviews.Author: catsprat
Reviews.Content: Staff was fun and friendly. The inn was only an industrial area, but it was like an oasis. Close to everything, clean, reasonable - all you could hope for on a budget. Right across the street from public transportation and the old town part of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a Heartbeat!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel for two nights in May. I had a wonderful experience. My room was a Deluxe room with a king sized bed. The room was large and very clean. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable with directions to any place I needed to go. I wanted to go downtown to the Gas Lamp District and the staff suggested taking the trolley. One of the trolley stops was located in Old Town, which is a short walking distant from the motel. I felt very safe, even returning back to the motel in the evening. It sure beats driving and paying extremely high parking prices. The trolley is the way to go. I enjoyed their free breakfast bar (cereals, breads, fruits, muffins & bagals)free breakfast bar. It also had a variety of juices, milk and coffee. I never left on an empty stomach. There was a very pleasant young lady constantly making sure that the food was always in supply. I did not get a chance to swim in the pool, but it did look charming and inviting. I know if I return to San Diego again, that I will definitely stay at the Old Town Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the Area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Old Town Inn and agree with the reviews posted by the previous guests that this hotel is definetly worth staying at. We stayed there on a very busy weekend (The marathon was was going on there) and unlike most of the Hotels that were either sold out or were asking for $200-$400 for 1 night we were able to secure a rate of under $100. David the front desk manager (who must live at the hotel since he was the one I made the reservation with, checked us in, and then was there on our departure) was very helpful with the accomodations and directions to and from the property. He even provided us with an early check-in and was always seemingly happy to assist us with everything. Listen, this is not a Hilton or Mariott, but for the price, clean rooms, and EASY access to/from downtown I will definetly consider staying here again. Did I forget to mention....FREE parking and a continental breakfast that is nicely laid out for you in a dining room? My only concern in writing this review is that too many people will consider staying here and there goes the great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay at this hotel after reading all of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. This is definitely the place to stay in San Diego if you are not renting a car. We were able to walk to the Sports Arena, the reason we were in town. Also, the trolley and bus lines are right up the road. We were able to get to SeaWorld, the Zoo, and the beach easily using the station. The hotel is in an industrial area (next to a psychiatric hospital) but we still felt safe enough to walk back to the hotel in the dark. We stayed May 29-June 2 in an older economy room. We checked in 3 hours early with no problems and would have been upgraded at no charge, had there been a nicer available-but it was the holiday weekend, so they were booked solid. The room and bathroom were tiny and the shower made an awful squealing noise(not pleasant to wake up to!) The pool area was nice, beautiful flowers everywhere, but no hot tub. The breakfast was good, service at the front desk was unbeatable. Doug was especially corteous and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FXDXRIDER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Old Town Inn for four nights from May 23 to May 27. What a wonderful place to stay. My friend and I were even able to check in two hours before normal check-in time. The room we stayed in was on the third floor, very clean, roomy and quiet. Had a kitchenette and the staff even gave us a box of dishes, pans and utensils to use during out stay. The grounds of the Inn are nicely landscaped and has plenty of parking available. The continental breakfast they offered was another plus. The Inn is centrally located and the printout the staff gave us of directions to sites and stores was extremely helpful. Laundry room wasn't expensive and they have full load machines...drying time was an unbelievable 40 minutes. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel and have already suggested it to friends and relatives. Will definately stay here on my next trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: Lov2tvl
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Old Town Inn last week for four nights. I researched this hotel on this site and decided to give it a try. I am glad I did. We had room 136 in the older part and looked out to the pool and all the beautiful flowers all around the hotel. The staff was wonderful and so friendly. The breakfast was adequate and the room although it was old had good beds. For the price and the closeness to Old Town and the Trolley and bus terminal (right across the street) I think it was a very good deal. I'd go back there if I ever go into San Deigo again because it is so easy to get anywhere from there.

Reviews.Title: “Just as the reviews said. It was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of all the reviews in tripadvisor.com after trying to find a good hotel with a reasonable price which hardly any at all in San Diego area. We stayed for 2 nights from May 20 - May 22 for our 16th wedding anniversary. I thought I got more than what I bargained for! I was impressed with the size of the room, the cleanliness, the friendliness of the staff, the inn's landscaping, and the BREAKFAST! We have been to inns with continental breakfast before, but this one is definitely the BEST. I agree with all the positive reviews of this hotel in this site. I haven't tried using the transportation that was recommended by others in their reviews but definitely will try it next time since we definitely will go back. But we did use the recommendations of the staff to visit Old Town and had a very good time. Old Town has the best Mexican food there is. The driving directions that the staff gave us to the Gas Lamp District was right and was very useful! We did try the pool and the water was warm, 82 F. The landscaping is pleasing to the eyes (water fountain, green grass and foliage, and flowers). Agree, if you are used to Hyatt hotel, this is definitely not your choice. But if you overlook the surroundings of the inn and just concentrate on what this inn offers to you, you will leave this hotel with much better feeling than if you stayed in Hyatt. Staying in this inn, you will receive the personal attention and help from the staff that you won't get in the luxurious hotels. It should have been called a Bed & Breakfast because it has the feel for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: archimedes6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 5 nights during 2 stays in April and May 2005. The hotel is certainly convenient, clean, friendly and excellent value but ..... the location next to a busy road in an indutrial/commercial area is definitely NOT attractive. Having said that, it is and ideal base for a visit to San Diego with excellent access to transport and convenient links by road (right next to the I% interstate). I agree with everything that has been said in other positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Was impressed ”
Reviews.Author: WDBGUY
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place, property is well kept and beautiful. The rates, location and access to transportation cannot be beat. The staff is very friendly and greeted us every time we walked into the lobby, they were well informed about directions to local attractions and even had printed directions to hand out. the pool area is nicely landscaped and attractive. I will not stay anywhere else is San Diego. They made it a very positive travel experience. The economy room is great for the budget, no frills basic but still nice. continental breakfast was exceptional, fruit salad, danish, cereal, muffins, bagels and even hard boiled eggs. The breakfast room was very nice. I do not work for this place...felt they deserved my comments.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money & location for 'no car people'”
Reviews.Author: AliWorks2holiday
Reviews.Content: Just returned to England following stay. For anyone without a car this must be the place to stay. We (family with 2 children) were able to get to all the attractions easily and cheaply by using the local bus and trolley services, which were a 2 minute walk from the Old Town Inn. We found the public transport very efficient, clean and economical. Rooms and breakfast were good value for the price charged and staff helpful and friendly, Pool was heated and good laundry facilities. Also, Old Town was good, but probably best to book if you want to eat at the main 2 Mexican restaurants there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a week at the Old Town Inn after reading reviews online. With two children in college and a wedding coming up, budget was definitely on our mind! We booked their room with a King Size bed, refrigerator, and microwave and for the price were very pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and looked recently redecorated. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was continental (muffins, bagels, toast, cereal, fruit, etc.), but plentiful and served up in a new breakfast room. The trolley stop was a couple blocks away and old town just beyond that. Very accessible. We bought a three day ticket and took the trolley every day. Excellent restaurants within walking distance in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “great location can move around on bus and trolly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at old town inn,the staff was knowlegble I was able to take bus to zoo,seaworld. The bus was fast to get to your location 15 min to seaword 15 to zoo so why drive and pay parking.The old town inn is located by a main station for bus and trolley.If I go to san diego again I would stay at old town inn,the stress is gone on how to find your self around the staff will help ,just stay at a hotel who knows nothing about how to get any where and you will love staying at this hotel.They have a good breakfast the pool is 80 so the kids love the pool at night or on a cool day.

Reviews.Title: “Good ECONOMICAL hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied with the Old Town Inn and we would recommend it to anyone. We stayed in an "Economy" room because everything else was full. Although the room is small, it is clean and cozy. The few downsides are: 1) The floor is squeaky 2) No bathtube (in economy room) 3) Sound of running water when the room upstairs is taking a shower. However, the continental BREAKFAST is AMONG THE BEST that I've ever experienced. The breakfast room is cute and clean. Front desk staff are freiendly. The location is walking distance to Old Town. I would stay here again but in a Deluxe room where the bathtube is available. Give the Old Town Inn a try. It is a good hotel for a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great little inn with a price we couldn't pass up. It was clean, the staff was friendly, it had a decent pool area though we never took advantage. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. You can't ask for a better location in Old Town. We were able to walk to all the restaurants without a problem and didn't feel unsafe at night. It is directly across from the trolley stop which was so convienent to go downtown or into the Gaslamp Quarter. We ended up taking that every night into the city and back and it worked perfectly. It would be highly recommended for anyone on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, good value.”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel directly and got a nightly rate of $55 (including tax!) for a small, livable room. No frills, to put it mildly: shower, no tub; no coffee pot, iron or hair dryer. The continental breakfast was OK and the heated pool was a delight. And though the area looks rather desolate, it's around the corner from Old Town and a quick drive down Pacific Highway to downtown, Gaslamp, Balboa Park, the Zoo, or just about anywhere else you want to go in SD. I was satisfied, though next time I may pay more for more amenities. (Note: I arrived after noon and still had to wait for my room to be readied.)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for tight budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice location, close to the trolley station. Nice continental breakfast. However, ,my room smell like smoking, even though I requested non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Found my hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three-night stay at the Old Town Inn in San Diego. A friend and I stayed in one of the budget rooms in the old wing which was somewhat spartan but adequate and comfortable. We liked the following about the hotel: 1) we could walk to Old Town and to the the bus and trolley station (we used the bus to get to Sea World; 2) a nice continental breakfast was included with the room, and coffee, tea and hot chocolate was available 24 hours a day in the breakfast room; 3) the staff was friendly, helpful and ready with printed directions on how to get everywhere you might want to go whether by foot, public transportation or by private car. I will definitely use this hotel when I visit San Diego; I will probably upgrade to one of the better rooms, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, and the staff is very friendly. Upon our arrival, we were briefed on the attractions of San Diego and also a map of how to get there by various means of transportation. We were given a room with microwave and refrigerator for a very good price. I strongly recommend this hotel/inn to everyone who wants to get the best bang for their bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: gzellner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights the first week in November. We had a very nice room in the "A" building. The room was clean and spacious. Yes, the air conditioner was a little noisy and shower head low, but there's no such thing as a perfect room and it didn't affect our visit. The staff, Lela, David and the rest were very pleasant and provided information about nearby attractions. The continental breakfast was also very good. Old Town was within walking distance. The zoo and balboa park was only about a 15 minute drive. The train even takes you to the Mexican border. We had a great time. This is a hotel for everyday people. If you're looking for the Hilton or the Marriott, this is not the place for you, but if you're looking for a clean, reasonably priced room with nice people, then the Old Town Inn is for you. We would stay here again and again. The people who stayed in older rooms should have reported the problems to the staff and asked to be moved. I'm sure they would have accommodated them if another room was available.

Reviews.Title: “What a disapointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay here, make sure you don't stay in "the Bungalow's". First off a new coat of paint will not a new home make. I have never stayed in a such a smelly room. It smelled like there was a group of monkey's chain-smoking for weeks. The front desk girl did not even ask us if smoking room was ok. The curtains were the color of a dirty cigarette filter, and would not close using the string, you had to force them closed by hand. The screen in the window was ripped. There was blood splatter on the bathroom wall. The bathroom window overlooked the lovley smelling garbadge pails. Our bedsheet was greasy and looked like it a used noxema pad. I wonder if they even ever washed them. The sheets felt cheap and itchy. The blanket had burn holes in it. The furniture had burn marks on it from people who left cigarretts there. The room was 9x10, maybe, and there were 5 ashtrays in it. Who the hell needs 5 ashtrays in a room that small. And why would you give a couple a two bed room? We will be sleeping in the same bed. The pool was freezing. Why couldn't they atleast turn ON the heat? The one saving grace is the continental breakfast. I have never seen such a nice spread for a free breakfast. So we were roped in by a bargain discount, and if we had stayed in a regular room, not the bungalows, I think our stay would have been ok. But if you stay here, make sure you get the more modern side of the facilty. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price & Location”
Reviews.Author: paul686
Reviews.Content: The Positive: Clean, Safe, Great Continental Breakfast, Close to Seaworld, Zoo, Downtown, Heated pool, Great staff. Negative: Old Building but has been updated; Therefore, Thin walls. Train goes by 7:08 am everyday. They also allow pets in any room; Not good for someone with allergies.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I originally picked the Old Town Inn because of their special rate. It was a lot less than most of the motels in San Diego. I was a bit hesitant to stay there. As in the previous review, it is located in an industrial area but the establishment is like a little Oasis. Our room was very very nice, a lot of extra amenities; like a microwave, mini-frig and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff is very courteous and friendly. It was also very close to Old Town. It was a truly enjoyable stay there and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Old Town Inn for one night in late August,2004. I chose it because of the TripAdvisor recommendations and because we would be without a car and it was within walking distance of Old Town and near the airport. We chuckled a bit at the location -- sandwiched between a large manufacturing building, the Marine Recruit Depot and a State Psychiatric Hospital. However, we loved the fact that it provided an oasis, was an easy walk to Old Town, and we felt completely safe, even walking back at night. When we checked in, David indicated that the room we had requested wasn't very nice and suggested that we stay in the bunglaloo near the pool for the same price. While the room was small, it was very comfortable and looked out on the pool. There seemed to be flowers everywhere! I would certainly stay at the Old Town Inn again and would definitely recommend it, particularly if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Rude desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: JBM
Reviews.Content: I had a prepaid reservation four months in advance and called 2 weeks in advance to confirm our dates and time which was Oct.4 to Oct.9. I talked to David the desk manager who confirmed these dates. I was there with my daughter for her 12th birthday. After a day at Sea World, we returned to our room to find us locked out. This was Oct.8 David the desk manager yelled at me and my young daughter and said we were supposed to check out a day early. He mistakenly stated that he had told me that morning that we were suppose to check out. This confrontation caused my daughter to get so very upset that she started to cry. When I was finally let back into my room I got the paper to prove to the desk manager that we had another day paid for. David the desk manager did not have the courtesy to apologize for his egregous error. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK accommodation at convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ADMcD
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn is located very conveniently for the trolley to get downtown (I didn't have a car and managed fine). Room was clean and reasonably comfortable. Breakfast was good, but breakfast room got busy. Overall, quality seemed fair for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Snorkling_man
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Very nice. Good Breakfast. They have laundry facilities. Good services.

HotelInfo.Name: Old Town Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 4444 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92110
